content:
ry 27
Product received for free
theHunter: Call of the WildGameplayIt needs to be out of the way first, theHunter: Call of the Wild is about hunting wildlife. If you are okay with that, then the game is going to be pretty much what you expected. I played the original Hunter quite a while back and I was not able to get into it for some reason. theHunter: Call of the Wild seems much more streamlined than the previous game which was pretty inviting for me as well as new player to the series. theHunter: Call of the Wild puts you in the boots of a Hunter in a huge open world with the prospect of hunting virtual wildlife. That is pretty much all the story that is present in the game, because even after the narrator telling you a few lines and giving you some quests, it is pretty vague. Do not go in expecting a brilliant narrative adventure out of this game. Now, how does the actual hunting holds up.For the most part, the hunting in theHunter: Call of the Wild is pretty solid. You get all kinds of tools at your disposal to hunt down the surprising less diverse wildlife. From noise maker to sprays to attract your prey towards a location and then putting a bullet through their lungs, that is the game. theHunter: Call of the Wild does falter in the skill tree it uses to unlock all these fancy tools and you really need to grind your way by murdering quite a lot of fauna.  This requires a lot of patience and time and might frustrate some players. You can unlock Far Cry 3 like towers which show you points of interests on that particular part of the map. The gun recoils are nice and feel quite good to use.Don’t expect to go in all bullet blazing though like a Call of Duty game. theHunter: Call of the Wild requires you to be patient and wait for the creature to be at a perfect position when you take the shot. The animal can even run away wounded and you will have to follow its blood trail to track and hunt it down. theHunter: Call of the Wild is at its best in these moments, I remember trailing a rare bear for some time following a blood trail it left and finally catching it a water body it came near to drink. It keeps you immersed in these moments and truly feels like something special. The wildlife is also very quick to react and they make the world a living breathing one. But in theHunter: Call of the Wild you’re basically like a god. It is nigh impossible for a creature to kill you unless you stand right in front of a bear. Even the fall damage from a high outpost isn’t enough to actually kill you. I felt bad for these poor creatures who were just waiting to be preyed upon. There is no food requirement, nothing that can force you to tense up. You can go hunting in the night and there will be literally no other danger. While there is plenty of wildlife to hunt, the diversity is pretty low. More often than not you will run into yet another bear or deer and it gets very repetitive after a while. You also have to walk a lot which is expected but it won’t please most of the audience. It is not helped by the fact that theHunter: Call of the Wild is extremely buggy. I can’t recall how many times a creature clipped through the trees, my bullets just whizzed past the animal’s lungs without hurting it and the constant crashes are enough the annoy anyone out of their wits. While the multiplayer works fine when playing with friends, it seems that this game is not really made for it. Too many hunters spoil a game and it is very much true here. VisualsVisually theHunter: Call of the Wild looks stunning. From the god rays of the sun to the gentle breeze flowing through the forest, it is one of the prettiest games I’ve played. The animal models are also really stunning and the game just takes your breath away quite some times with the beautiful vistas it presents. There is a fair amount of visual pop in and there are some really hilarious visual glitches which might break your immersion sometimes but overall it is pretty beautiful. What is a letdown though are the human models in multiplayer. They look like someone put a bunch of dolls in a jungle and that does help the game.SoundExcellent. From the animals sounds to just the rain pattering on the leaves, everything is done beautifully. The only trouble is when you walk through a water body which is when your shoes make more sounds than a bear who is ready to mate. But overall it has an excellent sound package.OverallI can’t help but like theHunter: Call of the Wild. It has its problems and it does certainly feel like an early access game but if you want a proper hunting game, theHunter: Call of the Wild should be your choice. It needs some polish and more content but as it stands, it is a solid hunting game which sports outstanding visuals and excellent sound design. It is not for everyone though and you should keep that in mind if you are purchasing this game. Rating: 65/100This review was brought to you by Review Experts through the generous contribution of Daniël - REX ♥ Gaming

												It has the most beautiful forest I have seen in a game yet.Multiplayer works pretty well (2 players).Walking trough the forest feels AMAZING. Not only the graphics, lightning and weather effects but also the bushes trees and grass, which react to your and the animals movement. Hell, I could play this game just walking around in the beatiful environment. In high grass you can clearly see where you or animals have traveled, as a path will be visible. The sounds of the animals are spot on as well. If you turn off all the help such as highlighting of spotted animals or trails, the immersion is pretty good. However, there are some bugs, for example the attacking animation of european bisons seems to be a bit broken. Some time the multiplayer might crash as well (I had one akward moment where i coulden't see any more prey or animals downed by the other player but bloodtains and stuff were visible, or one time where the headlight went on and i coulden't switch it off). And in multiplayer its seems like only the host can discover places and build stuff. They will be marked for the other player in his session but he cant get XP from them or fast travel to newly disovered huts, only when he visits those locations in his self hosted games he can that.Still, the immersion, the graphics and the gameplay feel spot on and I can only recoomend this games to players who enjoy the tension of searching for a target and don't mind spending much time walking in a beautiful virtual environment.Sure there are some bugs but restarting the game always helps and within the 14 h playtime on clock they diden't happen that frequently (maybe 4 restarts needed and 1 crash). Which I can forgive as they still continue working on the game.

												with a price tag on this game, i cant recommend it as it is now. its is wayyyyyy "early access".problems i have been facing in the 8 hours i have played:1)Randomly, after opening and closing the map everything becomes sluggish and wont return to normal unless i pull out the GPS and put it away, not everytime, but still. also, you have the option to place a marker on the GPS map, but nowhere on your HUD does it display the marker, not on your compas or on your gps handheld, so everytime you want to make sure you are still heading in the right direction, you have to open the full page map and check. this is why the sluggish bug is annoying, because you are constantly opening and closing the map.2) invincible animals. I have put multiple rounds into multiples animals and they wont die. I mean, 6+ shots into the vital region of a moose with no effect. a straight up vital shot on a bear, it charged me, stopped and sat down after clawing me, shot it in the head (not joking) and it ran off and procceded to waste over 45 minutes scouting a blood trail until giving up. this is beyond frustrating. I do not know how the mechanics work of an animals health and vital regions, but they are clearly broken. a white tail deer cant be gut shoted 4 times and simply walk it off.3) killed animals dissapear before i can claim them. I have had multiple times were i succesfully dropped a target at a great distance and it took me so long to walk to where i shot it it wasnt there. mutliple times. kill a deer, bear, moose, elk.... spend over 30 minutes REAL TIME walking to it (was on other side of massive lake) for it to not be there.4) weather makes no sense, had a thunder storm with clear skies. constant fog off on all day. rain with clear skies. yes hunting season (fall) can have crazy weather, but not every damn day is a storm of the ages. tune it back a bit please, or give us the option to turn off weather effects5) store inventory is weird and buggy. no notification of a transcation. just asks "are you sure" gives yes or no option, but the yes or no option stays up if you click yes and nothing tells you a purchase was made.6) there are still mechanics in this game from when it was the free-to-play. you can rest at a cabin to fast forward time, it has a cooldown if you use it often, but has option to spend cash to override it, didnt remove any of my game currency when i used it, so i think its still left over from f2p. this might also be why the marketplace is all goofy, still havent transitioned over from their microtransactions.7) some of the "immortal" animals" show back up dead after a fast travel. but its beyond annoying. a huge part of the game is tracking, when you claim an animal it removes all the tracks and blood spots of that animal. but witht eh above problems it makes tracking a shot animal impossible. you have an entire traits tree you can invest in for it, but with no animals dying when shot, or disappearing, it leaves massive amounts of previous tracks and blood trails that constaly overlap fresh game trails, ruining the game.8) guns haveing confusing stats. i hunt, so i have some knowledge about calibers and which you would use for what, but i doubt everyone who buys this game does, and the stats for rifles dont really have a "firepower" category for the less gun savy people. or atleast a "recommended use for the following animals: x,y,z". and with how grindy this game is to unlock and purchase guns, it sort of needs that to avoid wasted purchases and just user friendly UI9) all animals are the same model, there are no "big" or "small" bucks, all look like monsters until you go and claim them and see the points givent. this is a hunting game, there should be spikes and two pointers and all that.at the end of it, id play the eff out of this game if where fully complete, but is far from it. i have 8 hours logged, and about 5-6 of those hours are tracking down blood trails of immortal deer or hiking to dead ones that aren't there. ultimately save your money and see if it comes on sale for a summer or winter steam sale, because they have months of patches they need to do before its ok to play.

number of helpful: 33 of 55 people (60%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
14
												Just hit 84 hours, and I think it's time to stop.This game looks incredible, I've found myself taking tons of screenshots, especially for kills I was proud of. Let me be clear here, I don't like hunting, I don't agree with hunting, but this game is SO good that I've put 84 hours into it. The positives outnumber the negatives, but unfortunately the game has one whopping failure. So the game itself looks incredible, I've found myself reminiscing about holidays I've been on due to the realism and immersivety. The sounds fit in well with the setting (even if a few things could be worked on) The maps are huge and have some incredible points of interest that have clearly had a lot of time spent on them. The animals are difficult to hunt and you have to be mindful of many different ways in which you play in order to stalk an animal and get up and close. This is great! Going from scaring everything off in the vicinity to being able to get within 20m of a deer feels like great progress. The guns seem fairly priced, the missions tell you stories that are pretty interesting. You can choose whether or not you want to do a mission - you'd probably spend a good 50 hours walking round and exploring if killing isn't your thing. The game really is incredible. However, 84 hours in I'm here typing a review for a game that I don't recommend. So let me explain. About 20 hours into the game a friend asked me if it was worth buying, and I told them absolutely. 5 minutes later, my game crashes. My entire system crashes and I have to restart my PC manually. Frustrating, a waste of ammo and time, but no big deal. I reload the game, 5 minutes later, it crashes again. I get the frozen screen, sound loop, I can't alt-f4, I can't Ctrl-alt-delete. Again, I have to manually restart my computer. Turns out it's not just me getting this issue, so with the help of the discussions I try what seemed like 3000 different settings changes just to see if the game is playable. Next time I start up the game, I get 4-5 hours out of it then stop playing, seemed like something had worked. Load up the game again, crashes within 30 minutes. To this day I am still dealing with crashes that seem to have no correlation to any setting, any part of the map, any animal, anything. I've changed so many settings at this point that I'm literally just playing inbetween crashes and every now and then it'll crash so many times in such a short space of time I just give up.This game is literally incredible. I've had crashes ever since 16 hours and yet I've still put up with it up until now. But I cannot recommend this game. It's not badly priced, but this game desperately needed to be released as an alpha or beta. It's just not ready. There are some other bugs (floating guns, weird arm twisty thing, animals getting stuck, rocks killing you for absolutely no reason) but these do not break the game. They're few and far between and they're absolutely bearable. Sitting at my PC for 2 hours and having a game crash 30 times within that time frame is absolutely soul destroying. TO SUM UPIf you're patient, love hunting, fancy a walking simulator or even a fantastic hunting sim, then maybe give it a shot. If you want the game to run smoothly and want to play with friends, really really avoid this game. 84 hours and I don't think I'll be launching this game any time soon. I will say, the developers seem hard working and eager to fix the issues but this game was clearly rushed and isn't in a fit state to be released yet. I really hope they can fix it soon because it's such a great game, and has such great potential.

content:
ry 19
												[Edited 20/02/2017 1711hrs]I'm not usually inclined to write a review but i feel i ought to for this game, i will do my best to keep this updated as time goes on.For those of you that have played thehunter classic i wouldn't recommend it, for those of you that havn't played thehunter classic i still wouldn't wholeheartedly recommend, there are far too many things that the classic has or did better that dont exist in this new release to make it worth buying. A visual representation of where my view on this game is at the moment. I don't recommend  | I recommend[--------------------------//-|--------------------------]Pros:- Jumping! brilliant feature! Having the ability to jump up onto rocks above open terrain, go prone and wait for unsuspecting prey is a brilliant feature, personally i much prefer looking at terrain for firing positions than using the pre determined structures.- Not having to use your Huntermate to track animals, although it does aid you with an easy to follow cone of direction, you can quite happily walk with your rifle in your hands and track animals which helps dramatically in reducing the time to take the shot, nothing worse than cresting dead ground to find the animal standing mere metres away, with only your phone in your hand.- Having Need zones on the map - whether it be drinking, sleeping  or eating, you are given a time period in which animals of that type will use these need zones,which helps dramatically at ambushing prey and also giving them a less random feel, they live somewhat structured lives.- A few different ammo types per weapon, allows you to pick and choose which type of arrow or round you would prefer to use, Softpoint or Polymer.- Easy to see and understand unlockable skills, this gives an RPG feel to the game as you feel you are progressing toward something, it also gives you the choice in which areas you would like to progress, whether it be stalking or ambushing, and perks for the type of weapons you use most.- Vast expanse of land to hunt on, this game truly does feel vast with two large reserves to hunt on, both with different landscapes.- The sheer amount of animals on each reserve is staggering and i doubt you have to go particular far in any direction from any position in order to find them wandering around.- Animals regularly herd together, the most i've seen so far was about 30 odd whitetails wandering together at the foot of a valley, it truly was a sight to see.- Hunting animals in the same area means animals will start to avoid that area until it has "cooled down", animals with their skittish nature will avoid areas in which they feel threatened, you will still see animals in these areas just less of them, and the more you hunt in the same spot the less animals will wander into it.- When walking through particular thick vegetation/trees you hear the sound of your nylon jacket, which is incredibly immersive, however rabbits running through the same vegetation appear the make the same noise, i didnt know rabbits were made of nylon (i will admit that after several years of neglecting ear defense this may just be that my hearing is shot and that the two sounds appear to me as the same sound)- There is a guide available by Daniel which shows you how to make your game less blurry and sharper, im enjoying the game more now that i have wiped the slober out of my eyes.- No microtransactions - probably the biggest selling point of this game.- Heart rate and stances effecting weapon sway, this prevents you from being able to run and gun accurately (not that you would neccesarily want to but a good game mechanic to have)- When in the prone position grass and foliage infront of you inhibits sight picture on target, personally i love this, it requires you to either crawl forward to flatten the grass then crawl back in order to optomise your firing postion, or move to a spot where grass wont effect your sight. - The ability to turn off tutorials / mission system / multiplayer nametags / downed animal highlight / spotting outline / audio clue visualization / spatial tracking cone / Points of interest / need zone icons / track effects. Turning everything off gives you the ability to hunt with your own hearing and sight.- Animals leave "channels" in long grass and brush, this helps when stalking or chasing down a wounded animal as an almost perfect trail is left behind.Cons:- Graphics, the graphics are OK but are incredibly hard to run for those with dated PCs, i would go as far to say it is heavily unoptimised. Even with the ability to max any modern released game you will be pushing 30 - 60 FPS with medium/high settings in which the foliage will look less than realistic.- The horrible grind to unlock weapons/lures/etc in the shops - you have to harvest an outrageous amount of animals in order to unlock even the most simple lures or weapon of choice, i feel you should be able to buy any of the kit from get go.- Animals very rarily spook, you can shoot and harvest one only to walk a short distance and repeat, gunshots/running for the most part dont have a very large spook radius.- Fast traveling is virtually non existent which is a pain as you have to take time to travel to need zones or particular favourite spots, the ability to put down tents in TheHunter classic sorted this problem.- No ability to errect your own structures, such as tree stands, 360 stands, ground hides etc, the fact that TheHunter classic has this feature yet the new edition doesn't is a real shame, it feels like a real step backwards.- By Comparison to TheHunter classic there is very little equipment/weapons/lures available, which i hope with potential future DLC will be expanded upon, again a step backwards.- The game states that clothes do not have any effect on whether animals can detect you, this again is a feature that is included in theHunter classic with the addition of Ghillie suits, 3D sneaky clothing etc.- The bugs although not game destroying are rather annoying and with some fairly simple bugs i am astounded that this game was released with them, and that after days after release they still persist is mind boggling.- According to the games sound indicator, you give the same amount of sound crawling slowly as you do running.- No ability to range your rifle to anything other than the pre determined 100m.Overall i feel this game is headed in the right direction but as it currently stands lacks some pretty major components of a hunter game, i feel a mixture between this and TheHunter Classic would be ideal, bring back some of those core gameplay elements whilst also bringing in better optimisation and bringing the grind feeling down to a nice enjoyable level and giving the player more freedom on what to hunt from the get go.Having said all that i still feel a burning urge to make this review even longer and do a side by side comparison of the two games which would show you just many features/gameplay aspects have been removed for the sake of improving the graphics, there are so many!

content:
ry 27
												So, before I get into this, for some unknown reason it is showing myself as having far less time than that I have clocked on on AMD Raptr.... I have tons more hours and have been playing a fair bit!So let us dive in by starting with the basics!Graphics: The graphics off this game are amazing! Seriously they are so good that you can only wish you can play on max to truely enjoy the game for what it really offers, thankfully I can so on this basis I would say the graphics alone are 9.5 out of 10 because they are that good!Audio: The guns sound good, the animal noises are good, rain, thunder, wind all are good but there are problems.  Example, you can hear the rain hammering down when walking but turn around and no rain sound at all, face forward and raining.. It's spinning the mouse to get different sounds which is amusing but a bad bug from my point of view, so I would say here 7 out of 10!Controls: The controls are simple to get used too, but the menu system controlling is horrible and buggy I found, the same as my wife and close friend.  Controlling through the menu is buggy and glitch as hell but if you are rating the walking, moving, gun, swapping etc, it's spot on so I would say 7 out of 10!Gameplay and everything esle:  Now the game! Yes, this game has it's fair share of bugs and problems.  Some are more problematic than others, while some are just pure annoying!Right now as I write this review, if you start a solo game and want to change to multiplayer, you have to physcially close the game down and reopen it and select multiplayer... The same the other way around! Once in a game there is no backing out to the main screen, silly idea!Walking and the level of detail though in this game is amazing.  The grass moves when you go through it, the same as tree's and the grass leaves an imprint on the path you have followed.  Seriously the level of detail is amazing!There are two worlds and not enough animals I found! One German world (Which my wife and I with a friend found this world to be the prettiest and hardest to do) and an American world which seems bland but both worlds seem to have barely any animals in them... I think if I remember correctly there are 12 animals in total in the game and it is 6 per world, which sucks.  The worlds on the other hand are MASSIVE.  It takes a long time to walk around and often get bored a little walking and side tracking to look for fun stuff.  You can fast travel to a safe house if you got them unlocked, but that is ONLY once you unlocked it.There are no vehicles in the game which sucks because they would be amazing to have I feel like many others and many others not, but then it is your choice if you wanted to use them!This is a slow paced game, so no run and gun.  Expect to take a long time, going slow (Which is often frustrating for me at times because it feels so slow I need to sprint)Would I recommend this game? If you are a big fan of hunting games and want something that is going to draw you in and keep you focused and enjoy a slow pace simulation style game then this is the game for you!I am swinging towards a 78% yes because it is unique and offers a fun amount of hours in the game! It is also multiplayer which is a lot more fun as we know with others.  Just the bugs are slightly annoying right now, no vehicles and limited hunting is a little off putting, otherwise good job!

												Lovely game, stunning graphics.Please do understand i love the game, i will keep playing but this should not have been released yet.We should be spammed with hot patches , but the patches are far betweenFull of gamebreaking bugs.- Tracks disappear when there is to many of them.- You can not save the game where you at, so it you have to walk to area where you was hunting again if you restart the game. (pitcha a tent and sleep trough the night/saving the game would be nice)-It did not run stable on my high end gaming machine, on my server i do get the +60 FPS in Ultra stable.-Some menu items doent stick and switch back to a previous or the default value,-Animals get stuck in trees, edge of the water or in some deadend parts of the map.Beside those there some annoying glitches and things.-Sometimes your scope glitches.-Sometimes your stuck in the ground comming out of the map (a jump fixes that) -You can buy one scope and fit it on multiple guns.-Animals sometimes act like idiots, just skipping about or not moving at all when a gun is fired near them.Some stuff also need work or clarification.-I spend more then 14 hours gametime to get a picture of two bears-The numbers for the gun and ammo specs do not make any sense to me.-An ingame tutorial would be much appreciated-Most hunting stands and blinds are in spots that dont make sense, some look out on a big tree or a rock. If you would go trough the trouble putting one up you make sure you have a premium unrestricted view.-The animals should interact more. I have seen a bear sitting and a dear bumped into him but he did not care at all.And last but not least;IT FLIPPING RAINS TO MUCH.This is a game, a single player game, let us choose if we want it to rain or not.It rains in real life, it is depressing, why would i durring my game time have it rain too?It is not even a realistic weather pattren, it flipping rains for 45 mitutes in an hour.If it would rain for a whole day in 1 in 15 game days it would be fine but how  it is done now is ridiculous.My faith in the "no rain" menu button that actualy sticks in a future patch is extreme high.Ofcourse it all going to be fixed and all will be honky donkey, but this should be tested before they relased the game.I do not want to participated in a payed betatest games anymore, this  game almost feels like a beta on the moment.Normaly i would have waited or not even bothered to write a review, but the review and the tumbs down maybe urges the Devs to put in some hours to fix the urgent things and keep us, the customers, informed. 												This is my second edit of this review, this time I'm going to be bit more in-depth.The game is well worth the $30 price tag. The game is gorgeous and contains 2 massive, interesting, and varied hunting reserves. I have yet to even explore more than 25% of each reserve.In my opinion the game has enough weapons for now, I've yet to use anything other than the starter rifle. The ammunition prices could be a bit more modest but I suppose it does encourage you to conserve ammo and take safe shots.The game still has a few AI bugs and UI problems here and there but after today's (3/3/2017) patch, I haven't experienced any crashes and have had more success in-game as a result of the sneaking fix. This game is relaxing, even if you don't enjoy hunting in real life (I don't) this game is still very enjoyable. Take a break from hunting and go out and explore for some artifacts, lookout points, and lore points.A few things I would like to see in the game:-Portable Campsites - Pack a tent for a mobile outpost (does not have to contain shop)-Tree Stands-Jonboats or canoes for navigating the rivers, lakes, and ponds of the world.-Fishing-Able to complete missions and unlock outposts/lookout points in multiplayer.See you on the trails!

content:
ry 19
												I bought this hoping it would be The Hunter 2. It's more like The Hunter Lite. It's a shooting gallery with pretty graphics. The difficult hunts that made the original so appealing are replaced with animals everywhere with no sense of self preservation. They call constantly and let you walk right up to them before they run.. And they even call several times specifically to warn you that they are about to run. So you can just run around at a full sprint and wait for the warning calls then stop and shoot them. Often times a shot doesn't even spook near by animals so you can lay waste to entire herds in a short time. The leveling grind also promotes this style of gameplay, needing to both earn ridiculous amounts of cash to buy new equipment as well as needing a ton of XP to unlock the ability to even purchase it. On the plus side its pretty, the landscapes are massive, the draw distance has nearly doubled and the shooting feels a lot better than classic. The game has a lot of potential but this isn't early access, this is a full release and they have no obligation to change anything. This combined with the history of Primal leaves one with doubts about the future of this title. Hopeful doubts, but doubts nonetheless.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=867566516Enough said.Some of the things in the game aren't explained properly and some are just worded wrong completely for example, one of the skills you can unlock is called "I'm only happy when it's raining" and there's two levels and they go like this.Lvl 1: Decrease visablity when it's foggy.Lvl 2: Decrease visablity when it's raining.See the problem? (This is a perk by the way, not something that disadvantages you), if you don't then my point has been validated.Multiplayer, It's still kinda broken. people are having more luck joining games but as we found out pressing F6 i think it's the multiplayer options for the lobby leader, just pressing that button was booting someone at random from our game so that was fun.Another issue i have is if you join your friend in MP, you both walk upto the other side of the map hunting and exploring on the way. If you find a lookout, lodge, point of interest, You simply can't interact with them which pisses me off for lodges. if you want to unlock that lodge you have to go back to single player and walk all the way back to the other side of the map and press E on it in SP.Speaking of pressing E on things it's a fun little mini game at points of interest, some of them i haven't been able to collect/interact with, some have been fine, others i have to run around them jumping and looking into the sky to get the interact option... and finally how many times andwhat i've been killed by.Wild Animals: 0Skyriming and simply falling down sheer clifs: 0 (I do it allot, fastest way to get down the mountain)Other players: 0 (if you get shot in the face the bullet impact decal is actually cement so go figure, were's actually statues hunting wildlife in the game)Trees: 4, Yes i've been killed 4 times by inanimate trees the second most lethal thing in the game.Rocks: 15, This is encluding my encounter when i started playing which killed me about 9 times respawning me in the same place to die again over and over, other times i'll just be walking along and stand on a rock funny and I instantly die sooo.... yeah.The good :D yes there's actually good.. well kinda.The game is very pretty and being an AMD Processor user i was greatful to realise their new engine actually spreads the load evenly over all 8 threads of my FX8350 and i'm actually maxing out my GTX 1060 running almost everything on ultra.there is however a slight kind of fuzzy ness i think caused by the Anti-Alisasing (for the record i have no idea what i'm talking about but it seems that kind of blurry/jagged edge look)There's also some issues where i'll play along at 50ish FPS in 1080p and then my FPS just tanks to 15-20 and it's eyestraining to play forcing me to restart the game (ofcourse if i haven't gotten to that unclaimed lodge i have to do the walk all over again -_-").Final Verdict:When this game works, it works in the most epic of fasions and i've had some rather intense encounters with Fallow deer. after following a herd i engaged some distance i finally found one that had dropped but i was then attacked by two cornered fallow, ended up using iron sites at 16m and lungshotting one that charged me while the other charged me right after and got away before i could get my bearings and get shots off in its direction.However in my opinion the game needs allot more polish and it should not have been released in its current state, I feel sorry for my fellow hunters who have to deal with the fustration of this game while it's being fixed and that's if it gets fixed. I've seen on a game news site they were responsible for Just Cause 3 and Mad Max, Mad max never had it's little niggles fixed like getting stuck and just derpy things and the short time i had Just cause i found it aweful to play, the controls and menus were just bad and poorly laid out and it shows how they've made the menus in theHunter: CotW.Edit for update 1.1:This game has become a boring walk around shoot ♥♥♥♥, by removing the work you had to put in to get the best stuff in the game they've literally turned their game into a feature bland theHunter Classic that looks pretty.

content:
14
												Sorry bit of a long one The Hunter call of the wild is one of the most stunning games graphical I have seen  in a long time the views are stunning which gives the game a real feel I have spent a long time just walking around and soaking in the amazing views form the lookout points and just watching the day go by sad I know but hay paid my money my game to play.The gun physics are good not being a hunter in real life and not having any time around real firearms can’t honestly say what a real rifle should do whist crouching behind a tree trying to shoot a moose at 150m but for a game they feel nice the rifle recoil seem fair and the bullet travel seems fair what has to be remembered is that this is not a FPS this is a hunting game so no 360 no scopes here the game is trying to simulate a real hunting feel (as stated never hunted so what do I know lol)The animals look real nice even though their behaviour is some time is not realistic never seen a deer walk round in circles four times but on a whole they seem to do as they should solo walks and group feeding and resting Now down to the pros and consProsGraphicsThese are amazing great textures on the animals the map is first class the grass bends beneath you and the animals Weather The sunny days look great with the sun shafts coming though trees and structures, the rain affects look amazing and the thunder sounds kudos to the sound engineers AnimalsThe animals are modelled and animated to a level which cannot really be complained about the behaviour of each species is slightly different every animal will give a warning call just to let you know you are getting to close but the red fox will be gone before you can even see it the bison on  the other hand will stand they ground for a little longer and may even turn the tables on you with you get them cornered Equipment They is a good selection of weapons in the game ranging from rifles to bows you start off with a single rifle for free and the stock ammo is free to buy the other weapons unlock on a rifle score points system the news guns are expensive which depending on your view is a good or bad thing my view is that this is a good thing as this makes you weigh up the options whilst buying new equipment thing like new calls will bring in small less value targets but with the numbers you can harvest will bring your money back up but this will is countered by the problem that hitting larger targets with a smaller calibre weapon will mean you have to track a wounded animal further cutting down on the number of harvests on each visit Cons Weather It rains a lot in this game be this just that the sound engineer had to spend days getting rain and thunders sounds so they put a lot in to make in worth their while I don’t know but it just seem to  rain all the time Animals I have seen on a few sessions animals getting stuck on trees and bushes I know people will say easy kill but in a game that is so amazing to look at a black bear doing the running man at a tree breaks the immersion Other Just a couple of things that made me scratch my head when I saw that they we not in the game at release and sorry to the devs if these are been implemented after this review (as if they read this lol) track ir not supported this was supported in the last the hunter title but has been replaced not to much of a problem as this do’s not really affected the game play but would be nice to have the ability to look around whilst walking as in real life, also the trophy shot has gone which was a bit of a surprise as the photo with your kill is a big part of hunter sharing with friends and other hunters a like I have seen an option on the main menu for a gallery which i have to hope means that it will make a return in a later patch My view The hunter call of the wild is the stepping stone from the hunter we all wanted this is not a game for people that are wanting to just walk in to a field and shoot 15 moose and walk away With the success of the hunter series so far this game has the potential to have the same success and in 8 years time have a still booming fan base

number of helpful: 8 of 12 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 16
												This game definitely wasn't ready for release. It's a (pretty bad) beta at best.After reading on the forums that Stefan, one of the developers, refuses to acknowledge one of the most game-breaking bugs (see below) and closes threads, I decided to request a refund.GraphicsThe game is pretty gorgeous looking, that's for sure. Good textures, day/night cycle, dynamic weather, wind moving leaves, grass, etc.I did experience a few minor issues though, like clouds flickering, the handheld occasionally being shown without its display (just the frame) or rain falling right through the roof of a deer stand (how there's still devs in 2017 not paying attention to something like that is beyond me).SoundSounds are very inconsistent in quality. Some sound very realistic with high production quality, others just sound terrible, with static noise at the beginning and/or end of the sound sample (at least when playing with headphones this was easily perceivable).I also repeatedly had issues with sounds ending abruptly (like animal calls or birds chirping) or stuttering, or ambient sounds like wind changing way too fast.Obviously issues like that are constantly breaking someones immersion.InterfaceThe menus are buggy, with buttons not always reacting to clicks. Some options like mouse sensitivity are also a pain to use, since you can only increase/decrease the value by clicking arrows to the left or right. There's no slider or a way to type in a value directly. Annoying, especially if the game doesn't save the settings properly and you have to re-do them the next time you launch the game. There's also no way to go back to the main menu -- you have to quit and restart the game for that (no joke).Several HUD elements don't scale properly when playing on a 16:10 screen. For example, the compass is oval, and markers on the map are oval as well. I suspect people with widescreen-monitors like 21:9 will be affected by this as well.There's also graphical glitches on the map, like terrain textures that aren't properly stitched together, and map overlays that are only partially visible.You can also disable certain aspects of the HUD (like tutorial hints or point of interest markers) or change how animal tracks are being visualized. Sometimes HUD elements can get stuck on your screen or behave strangely if you change the settings and don't restart the game afterwards.Animal AII'm not an animal expert, so I can't talk too much about this topic. But at least on two occasions, after firing a shot, deer ran away, just to come back several minutes later, walking right towards me, coming as close as 10 meters and not notice me at all. Well, I doubt any real animal would do that, unless they are suicidal.There's also reports of animals getting stuck, but I haven't seen that myself in game.Shooting/gunplayShooting seems weird. First I thought I'm doing something wrong, like missing vital organs, since I couldn't even kill non-moving small game from less than 50 meters. I then read in another review that someone was testing the shooting on stuck animals, and had to hit them with up to 6 rounds to kill them, from only a few meters away.A hunting game with broken gun mechanics. Awesome.PerformanceI'm on Windows 7 with an Intel i5-3570K (3.4 GHz, 4 cores, 4 threads) and a Radeon RX 470 (4 GB VRAM). I maxed out all graphics settings, only turned off motion blur. Resolution was set to 2560 × 1600 to reduce flickering of the foliage (native screen resolution is 1920 × 1200).I didn't measure the frames per second, but it was around 30. Which in my book is okay for a slow-paced game like this.ControlsMouse sensitivity is annoyingly low when using binoculars or scopes, even when set to 100 in the settings (the maximum). Maybe it's on purpose to make shooting more difficult, but then at least exclude the binoculars from that 'mechanic'.One severe issue is that you can't walk slowly when using keyboard & mouse, meaning your noise level is always at max when moving, no matter if you're standing, crouching or prone. For comparison, I tested it with my Xbox gamepad and it's fine there, but why would I play a first person hunting game on the PC with a controller?Now, as mentioned at the top of the review, several people have pointed out that issue on the forums, but it seems the developers just try to ignore it and refuse to acknowledge this being a major problem. Which led me to requesting a refund. Because it's bad enough to release a game in a state like this, but then trying to silence or ignore issues... I refuse to support stuff like that.If they fix all these issues (and there's a bunch more I didn't experience personally or forgot to mention) I'll gladly purchase this game again, but until then I recommend everyone to wait and see if the devs get their **** together.

												I really would like to give this game a good review. It's obviously made by professionals, and has a lot of potential. Unfortunately, it's just not possible to recommend someone spend $30 on this. There are too many bugs, and they're not just minor nuisances. It's irritating when the game starts up and the mouse cursor isn't locked to the screen, or you're just given the view from a player camera frozen in the air and you have to restart. I don't like it when you place a waypoint and it acts strangely, or the screen of your smart device disappears, or when you have to click a menu element five times to get it to respond. But when animals don't react to your presence, or when you shoot them and they freeze in place like statues that soak up your bullets, there's just no point in playing. The game's just broken, and you shouldn't buy something that's broken. Bugs aside, the only complaint I have is that the game is trying to be as realistic as possible, but geometry of the terrain is just generic video game terrain that doesn't even remotely resemble reality. They could salvage the game at some point, but right now, don't buy it.

content:
ry 17
Original review 17/02/2017Positives: Sound is incredible. Environment is gorgeous. Weather is fantastic. Tracking seems markedly better (though the new huntermate is practically useless). Animals react to being hit instead of just running and are visibly hurt when running away. Bears attack deer (hilarious). Weapons feel nicer.Negatives: BUGS, EVERYWHERE. Animal behaviour seems to be much worse than Classic, though could be bugged like everything else. UI sucks, buggy and badly designed in places. Mission progress resets if you change reserve. Changing reserve allows you to fast travel to any outpost you want and claim the XP again. Scoped weapons can bug out and prevent you from being able to see anything. More bugs. Bugs all day.Feels rushed to production. Full of bugs. UI design is not great and the bugs in the UI make it even worse than Classic's UI. There's currently more wrong with this game than right, which sucks.UPDATE 05/03/2017Played a few hours this morning, seemed less buggy.• Menu works generally as expected.• Animals still run into trees and rocks and inexplicably turn and walk directly away from you all the time only to return when you call them. Still don't seem to have the level of intelligence they had in classic, either.• Scopes on rifles still buggy, even when you're not using a scope they can bug out now too. • Temporary hunting stands buggy with bows (arrows shoot into wood instead of where you're aiming), not sure about rifles.Tried to play this afternoon, crashed twice in 5 minutes. Still not recommended.One last point I'll make is that I've realised, even though now it's less painful than the first iteration, the progression system is infuriating. I'm not saying it shouldn't be part of the game but its current implementation makes the game boring and repetitive.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 19
												It definitely has its issues, mostly related to bugs and some optimization issues, but I've had a lot of fun with the game.  I have no history with the series or hunting games in general really, but I find this game to be incredibly relaxing and immersive.  The visuals and sounds are awesome as well as you watch day shift to night and storms suddenly roll in with high winds and heavy rain.  If you are on the edge it might be worth waiting a bit for another patch or two to roll in and see if it fixes some of the bigger issues, however I took the dive myself despite seeing quite a few negative reviews and don't regret it.Pros:- Great visuals- Immersive sound design- It could just be because this is my introduction to his type of game, but it was a thrill listening for and tracking down animals to kill.  I look forward to some more difficult targets that will require more time.- Feels welcoming to players newer to this style of game with a bit more casual presentation.  This of course could be looked at negatively to veterans of this type of game or theHunter Classic.- Speedy loading times.  I don't even have a SSD, but this game loads from the title screen into the game world very quickly which surprised me considering how large the map is.- Various challenges, quests, and lore discovery locations are sprinkled throughout the map, giving some extra activities outside of general hunting.- The two hunting reserve maps are massive in sizeCons:- The biggest issue right now is that with mouse and keyboard controls you have little to no control over the speed of your movement in each of the stances (walking, crouching, prone).  If you have a controller and test the movement out on that, you'll notice with analog control you can move the stick varying amounts to control your speed and subsequently the amount of noise you make.  Considering how important it is to try and remain silent in a hunting game, this is a pretty big issue at the moment.  Either controller movement needs to have that disabled and rework the amount of noise each stance makes, or keyboard needs an keybinding to slow your pace to a level that makes minimal sound.- While I've had no crashes (Update: I have experienced my first crash, so this does seem to be a relevant issue for many players), I have had a performance bug which was causing framerate to drop significantly when I was tracking an animal's footprints a lot.  Having too many of these tracking markers will cause the framerate to drop after opening the map or looking at your Huntermate device.  It would fix itself by either putting away the Huntermate or if you killed the tracked animal and collected your trophy.- Semi annoying menu bug that doesn't let you back out of the menu with escape unless the mouse is hovering over one of the items on the side.- A few of the animals I've shot seemed like it should have been a clean kill, but they would somehow get away with just a minor wound and run off.  More often than not I found success with my shots though.- Animal AI was a bit wonky on at least one occasion with a fox that clearly should have been trying to run away, but instead was running circles around me like a friendly pet dog or something.  Perhaps it was being aggresive and trying to attack or something, but it seemed a bit bizarre with it essentially giving me an easy kill.- Right now it is limited to 12 different animals.  These do have variations to discover, but it would be nice to see some small game targets and birds as well.  I'm assuming we'll see this added down the line at some point when they add some of the planned free and paid DLC content.- The menus ui and control of them in general just feels like it needs a rework as they look and feel like a placeholder that has been in the game since an earlier state.  There are also some issues with the controls when managing your storage where it just seems to completely break when in that particular menu and you have to back out and open it back up to do anything.

content:
ry 16
												Its a beautiful game, the graphics are stunning.  However, it has many problems.The bad:1 -The animal AI is pretty bad, they just kind of derp around until they see you or you shoot them. I literally got headbutted by a moose that didn't even see me, it was just running and I happened to be in its path. 2 - The noise level your character makes is way to high by default, the only way you can move without spooking animals is to crawl prone, or mash the move button and take one step at a time.3 - Your character gets stuck on random things for no reason.4 - Theres no anti aliasing that I can find in the graphics.. like.. why?5 - There aren't tags, so its just kind of a "wander around murdering animals" simulator.  This is a plus for some people id imagine, but not for the hunting simulator croud. 6 - Your character moves sooooooooo slow.  Like its really annoying.7 - The only way to get other equipment is to collect animals, and you need to kill like 50 deer to get a new rifle/scope/ect.8 - The skill tree is very poorly done.  Like one of the traits is "See 15% less during fog".  Like... what?  How is that a perk?9 -Theres a bunch of pointless ♥♥♥♥ on the map.  Like theres just random pillars out in the wilderness that give you "lore".10 - There isn't much for a tutorial in the game.. it pretty much just drops you into the world.11 - Bad frames when foliage gets really thick.The good:1 - The tracking system is very user friendly. Although not realistic.2 - The map is very good looking.3 - There are 2 zones you can hunt in, and both are very large.4 - Theres plenty of action.  This may not be good if you are looking for realism.Thoughts:This game defintely has potential, but in its current state it seems unfinished. Theres plenty of stuff to hunt if you are looking for an arcadey hunting game, that's multiplayer. But if you are in the market for a simulator, I'd skip this one for now. 5/10

content:
ry 17
												An absolutely stunning game in terms of graphics and even audio, just the sound of the wind gusting by or the stunning vistas, heavy rainfall and animal vocals makes this an immersive game set in nature.The map is enormous, the scale is just simply put insane, you can walk for hours and hours and it won't get repetitive as it feels like its several maps in one with the diversity each area brings.Not to mention the amazing grass effects, you could if you want track an animal by following the grass it flattened, and you can also see your own and other players their paths, ocassionally i also used this to get a clean prone shot where normally that wouldn't be possible due to the grass being in the way.But each game comes with its downsides and this game also has no shortage of those.The gamebreaking ones to me were:In Multiplayer only the host can unlock map objects, such as hunting stands / outposts (important one, they allow fast travel)Animals get stuck, from my 12 hour experience i would say i have seen 1 in 8 getting stuck, mostly on edges or rocks with bears being a big outlier as i have seen 1 in 4 of them getting stuck.The UI design is unintuitive, being unable to exit to menu and aspecially when it comes to loading ammo/scopes onto a weapon, it's also impossible to read some of the descriptions as the text moves offscreen, and in quite a few cases i saw what i can only describe as a alpha/beta-like placeholder text for some of the ammo/scopes.Some minor issues/bugs i had were:Some crashes when tabbing out and back into the game, i fixed this by adding the "/Borderless" in the steam launch options.Sometimes got a bug with my scope being off center forcing me to restart the game, the adjustment ontop of the scope itself became my crosshair, unequipping etc didn't fix it sadly.In Multiplayer when another player jumps its heard across the map, i suppose this might be an engine issue as it also happened in the previous hunter game with someone reloading.When you fatally hit an animal they sometimes do this weird freeze for up to 1 second and then start to ragdoll, i would love to see this changed / fixed so that you feel more feedback from the bullet impact and it kinda just looks awkward as it is currently.Animals don't spook enough from gunshots sometimes it feels asif they don't even hear the gunshot, i've been able to shoot up to 3 animals ocassionally before they even started getting spooked, i would like to see the range that animals get spooked by gunshots increased.Animals don't seem to interact with eachother, i would've hoped they would introduce something like this, i believe they added something similar to classic with the introduction of wolves so it would be nice if this could be added eventually.And finally theres just too many animals on Layton district, i would prefer it if they were a bit more rare or more easily spooked just recently i shot 5 bears within 10 minutes and before that about 3 within 4 minutes, one of which was stuck underneath a bridge, although Hirschfelden seems fine.It's also too easy to spot an animal by zooming in on where its call came from, it feels like its fine when you are scoped out and they callout as it covers a wide area but you can zoom in to get a pinpoint location on where it called out from, I'm not sure if thats by design or not but it makes it too easy, you can turn the call direction and other effects off in the settings, but it would be nice to have a middle groundI would still recommend the game to anyone remotely interested in the setting or who played the previous game, it does clearly have some bugs that makes you question why it was released so soon,But if they fix / change most of these issues, i can see this as one of the best games this year and i look forward to what content they might still bring out.All in all what is here is a gorgeous landscape filled with tons of animals to hunt, great gunplay mechanics such as bullet drop and organ hits, amazing graphics and audio, but also some of the worst UI i've seen in a while, and quite some bugs which hopefully get fixed soon.

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 16
												To start off with, this is an absolutely beautiful game. The environment is stunning and the texturing and animations for the animals are incredible. The sounds are amazing. They've definitely done an excellent job with creating a visually spectacular game. However, I don't want a hunting game that's just pretty to look at, and that's just about all this one is so far - pretty.It is essentially a very dumbed down version of theHunter: Classic. While they improved certain mechanics such as the tracking system - making it so you don't have to have the HunterMate in your hand in order to track animals - and a visual wind direction right on the compass, they drastically oversimplified others. Size/rack variations are practically non-existant from what I've seen thus far, small game other than coyote is present, but not able to be harvested, there's no trophy shots (although you can always just take a photo manually prior to harvest), skill progression is global rather than per-species, and is based on general XP gain rather than skill-specific XP, and many of the points of interest which say they grant skill/perk points do not actually do so.  Overall it feels like they've gone the way of a Cabela's game - going from a simulation heavy title to an very arcade-like experience.Hopefully a lot of those issues can be handled by an update. Until then, if you're looking for something close to theHunter: Classic, this simply isn't it.

												Sorry, but this game is UNFINISHED. And:The amount of bugs is unacceptable for a game costing 30€ and being not early access. Some of the bugs are not even bugs - they are just a sign that the game is not ready yet. Example? - No EXIT-button in the menu (it seems due to the fact this game is obv. a console-port from work in progress --> yes, you will play an alpha-version on PC from a console-port which is not even released yet in 03/2017)- menu is absolutely horrible, buggy, ugly and unfinished. It's a conundrum how to put sighs and amunition on a weapon --> as mentioned, it's obviously a rough console-port- menu stays open in the background - so during game you change options, map or even fast travel incidently when 'hitting' something with your mouse which is hiding behind in the hidden but open menu (edit: solved with patch 1.41)- sounds are missing, too loud, not playing sometimes or not fitting (for example in muliplayer you can hear callers extremly loud even when it comes from a player on the other end of the map)- descriptions for some amuntion and options is completely wrong or reversed or do not work at all- why the hell you can find a scope for revolvers in the section for riffles? This is no serious bug, but shows that the developers throw this pre-alpha-game on the market even without ironing out the most visible errors- crasehes to desktop are very common for lots of users. In my case I do suffer it accidently over a period of timeThe game seems very unbalanced. And I think, the developers know it. What else could be the reason, they changed for expample the price of amunition and DOUBLED it. This is no tweaking of the balance - this is reinventing the game settings. There is no possibility for changing the game hardness. For beginners it seems to be good, running in ZOO full of animals. But for advanced guys this is no fun. Too  much animals in the game. And part of the animals are completely AI-buggy. Example?I hunted down approx. 15 deers in the northern part of the US-map. They stood in shallow water and did not react when shooting on them or on they neighbours. Other animals stick in rocks or trees. Or do not react at all. Example (not my clip):


YouTube™ Video: theHunter Call of the Wild: Most realistic bugs simulator 

			Views: 219		

			A lot of bugs. not playable. no comments...		

Or this (not my clip):


YouTube™ Video: TheHunter: Call of the wild bug report Feb 16 2017 

			Views: 258		

			While traveling up to a look out point I ran into these guys who I am assuming that they were frozen due to my light...Not sure whats going on , but a nice payday.		

Sorry - but I can not recomend this game due to the fact, that CORE ELEMENTS of this game are messed up. Edit 11.03.2017:After about 60 hours playing this thing, it suddenly started to crash every 3 minutes. In both maps. With same PC-configuration, even without changing anything on the PC (it's the gamig computer). I regard it as completely unacceptable by DEVELOPERS and PUBLISHERS to release this game and/or not willing to give a refund. The problems did not start inbetween the first 2 hours of playing - so STEAM is not willing to take back this bug-feast.Edit 27.03.2017:Patch 1.4 and still no real progress. Players find NEW BUGS en masse, weappons are out of order, developers are still not able to ad a simple button in the menue, UI has still very serious bugs, animal-AI still extrem bad and for lots of players the game does not even start!But developers have a new information for us:THEY ARE WORKING ON THE CONSOLE-PORT to XBox and PlayStation! Great. They are concentrating on real important topics:Make MORE money! Do not listen to customers, or even try to iron out bugs. Make MORE money!Happy Hunting!Edit 29.03.2017 Patch 4.1:Small patch, UI ist still a mess and partly not functioning. Players report newe bugs or bugs beeing solved now reactivated (for example dying instantly on game start).Edit 31.03.2017:Now due to my repeated criticism in the forum I have been BANNED. 												While I would reccomend this game for the hunting enthusiast, I would caution casual or fast-paced gamers from playing. This game requires A LOT of time and effort to get anything done. Movement is slow, the game is quite demanding on moderate systems, and kills are very few and far between. Just today, I have spent almost four full hours of playing the game and have only managed to kill one deer. Yes, the game looks amazing and is very realistic, but it is certianly not something that the "average gamer" would enjoy. Where other games have long hours of grinding, where you're at least doing SOMETHING, this game has you walking (at an extremely slow pace to keep the animals from getting scared off) for hours on end with little-to-no signs of life for most of that time.While I commend the developers for making a challenging and realistic game, I would advise them to put options into the game to increase the spawn rate of animals in single player worlds and on multiplayer servers. To spend so much time in the game and get little out of it is not something that people enjoy. The game isn't difficult, it just discourages people playing it because of how little actually happens in the game.

												*Editing review*2017-02-19Okay so ive been playing non-stop for the past days since release, i am now level 19.COTW still runs great and the bugs really dont bother me at all, but after playing so much, the flaws in the gameplay really become an apparent issue.Too many animals, they are everywhere almost all the time, very rarely do you go 30 mins without seeing an animal (usually see 2 about every 10 mins) which for a hunting sim is way too much.Warning calls are BS and should be taken out of the game. I feel like its the whole reason it seems like there is so much wildlife. you hear them EVERYWHERE! Yes you can turn the blips off but youre just putting yourself at a disadvantage doing so...No fun in that either.Tournies, truRAC and leaderboards need to be added ASAP if this game wants to survive aslong as TheHunter Classic has. Of course only after the major bugs are fixed!as of now this is my personal opinion rating, if you disagree dont feel afraid to comment.Gameplay 6/10Sorry its just to darn easy, tracking is useless, unless it shoot the animal you are aiming for and there is almost no bullet drop.Graphics 10/10Its ♥♥♥♥ing gorgeous guys, seriously looks amazing, other then some muddy leave textures every once and a whileSound 9/10All the sounds are amazingly well done, Wind, rain and thunder all at once kills your ears and is way too loud. also rabbits OP!If youre a hardcore hunting fan just stick to classic unless you have money to burn, until they release patches.I am still reccommending the game, ive loved all my time in it so far! there are just a lot of gameplay issues!*release review* feb 14thCOTW imho should be at minimum labeled as "Early Access"there are some annoying UI bugs, ive crashed twice over the span of 12 hours, which really isnt bad.Ive had almost no issues with the game, other especially with AMD have it bad i hear.The Hunter Call of the Wild is, is a lot of fun and well worth the 35$ for me. but its far from finished, right now there is no tournaments, and leaderboards which really makes hunting sort of meaningless unless youre in a MP server where you can see other players top score.for 35$ it has more than enough content for me until the patches (hopefully tournaments) start rolling in.Nice physics, great graphics, runs crazyyyy smooth, honestly feels like it runs smoother than classic version. and not a god damn cashcow like classic aswell. if you want more content, then play classic but its going to cost you a hell of a lot more than this game will. I can see call of the wild being amazing if they do everything correctly.

												I am conflicted leaving this game a negative review. For what it is, the game is very beautiful and is very well detailed. When you first start it up you will be impressed with the surroundings and weapon graphics. The phone UI is a little whacky. In fact the UI in general is kind of weird.The AI is bad... really bad. When you first start, the game introduces you to tracking and killing an animal. This experience is pretty amazing. Then you go off doing "quests" and you realize that the open world AI is just flat out stupid. Animals walk into things. Deer literally keep coming back to the scene of the crime using the caller, until you murder their entire family. Getting into a hunting blind is cool... until literally everything becomes blind to you. I was calling for deer and a bear just walked up and stood there. Shot it in the neck for an instant kill and got a lot of XP.Sounds are amazing, for a while. You hear wind, walking through brush, rain, and trees all over along with the wildlife. But it gets repetitive and it can get really loud when you are trying to listen to things. When you hear the fog horn sound of a warning call, you will wake up the entire house with a feminine scream.All in all it's a cool game. But it is buggy and lacks real content. It's just a grind with a small variety of things to kill around you. I think this game could be amazing, and with some content and patches it probably will be, but for $30 I would just wait for a sale or some fixes. So my "negative" review is just one in waiting. I will pick this up again for sure when it goes on sale or a DLC comes out to fix and expand on things.

ry 17
As of this post I am level 15, 20+ hrs, Several Weapons and 100+ Animals down... Never played the OriginalFirst Impressions: I love it, great game, somewhat unfinished but everything these days is. A lot of people expect a finished game upon release which I find silly... Expectations of games in the modern day is insane, people think every game is a AAA title will hundreds of millions backing it. While the game isn't finished and many bugs are still out there it isn't game breaking and I have had no issues progressing. I had to adjust playstyle to accomodate bugs, mainly making too much sound while moving in any kind of stance (this includes the lower noise perks).I think give this game a little time and things will iron out, not all bugs are going to disappear but they will fix the major ones or at least I hope they do.Animals: The Animals are great, a huge range to shoot at and the bedding/feeding/drinking zones make finding a required animal a lot easier. The movement is pretty solid along with the animations of reactions to bullet fire or getting hit. I see a lot of people complaining about not being able to down a deer with the starter rifle and sorry to say but you are just a terrible shot. A heart or decent lung shot is going to drop a deer straight away if not a lung shot is going to have them run an extra 50m then die, anything else is just punishment for a terrible shot. Leading animals also appears to work well, more often then not I am able to get a 2nd or 3rd shot in before the animal is in cover or I have lost sight.Weapons: These are fine, I never played the original but having a background in FPS I am able to aim the rifle and hit my target at anything under 200m pretty easily. The 223 is a neat little fox hunting rifle which I have used on countless foxes including my 48,000,000 score kill (another bug). I have recently unlocked the 270 and it will drop pretty much any deer with a chest/shoulder shot. Progression on weapons is fine, its not too slow and definately not too fast. I would like to see more customization however this could happen in the future.Progression: Currently I am level 15 and it hasn't been a quick ride, having explored 80% of the map and killed over 100 animals it hasn't been easy. With that said I do like the progression, it isn't fast and I really have to work at it to get the unlocks I want. There is no quick level option in the game (that I know of) so doing what I am doing seems to be paying off in the long run. I also like how you have to progress with the weapon of choice, instead of just having a level requirement to shoot the best gun in the game. On that note by the time you unlock a better rifle you should be a better shot with rifles.Graphics: Amazing, running a 1070 makes this game look noice. Having played a few open world games now this does look amazing. From what I have heard from others this does look better then the original game which once again makes a lot of sense.Bugs: There is a few, a few really annoying ones which have turned away a few people I know.... That is fair enough and I respect that... However... Coming from Classic and expecting a polished game with the ability to just jump in and shoot whatever you want with whatever you want is not going to go down well.Overall: I would give it in its current state a 6/10 with the opportunity to hit 8/10 if the main bugs are fixed. I love how the game plays, how it looks and the progression. I love a challenge and having to really work for those quality kills, I will continue to play the game and looking to get some of those later unlocks.TL:DR - Overall great game for someone new to theHunter series, also for those looking for a hunter sim, different from Classic game, harder to bring those on Classic in current games state... Definately potential if bugs are corrected.

												Let's get it out of the way first - the environmental audiovisuals of this game are absolutely astonishing. Possibly the most beautifully realised and naturalistic open game world I've ever seen.Unfortunately the artistry, technical prowess and obvious dedication that went into the game world simply don't extend to the gameplay and UI. Quite simply the game should not have been released in its current state as anything other than early access, and the devs would be receiving a lot more support and understanding if it had been.Currently Hunter CotW is a hunting game where you can't quite trust that the casualised hunting mechanics are coming together properly. Bagging or losing an animal because the game glitched out rather than through your own skills or lack thereof kind of defeats the whole purpose. Numerous crashes, bugs, design flaws and gameplay oversights just add additional salt to the wound. I'll give it a positive review because even as incomplete and bug ridden as it is, the immersion from wandering around its incredibly realised world (and occasionally shooting things) is unbeatable. It just has a long long way to go to be considered a finished product.

content:
ry 25
												We know why you are here. Lets just get this out of the way right now. This has some of the most beautiful environments I've ever seen in a game. If you love the outdoors as much as I, then you where probably equally pained throughout the Elder Scroll's laughable attempts at wilderness. Skyrim's best just wasn't real enough for me. It all looked... unnatural, as if someone who had never been outdoors looked at pictures. The great outdoors got that name for a reason. This game understands. Freaking. Gorgeous. I play on Ultra with a measly 8gigs of Ram, GTX 970 and an i5 6400. It runs great. If the optimization is buggy, I havn't noticed.Next up, if you like hunting games, your options are fairly limited. The Hunter Classic, Cabela's Hunts, maybe Hunting Unlimited if you can stomach the ancient graphics and mechanics. Now The Hunter Classic is a favorite of mine, despite my low play time, it rocked. I'm currently getting into Bowhunting IRL, and when I play these types of games, I'm looking at Bows only. Make of that what you will.The Hunter Classic had a variety of weapons, animals, and reserves. In comparison CotW, is pretty underwhelming. TWO BOW TYPES!? WHAT IS THIS HERESY!? Not even a recurve, or a longbow, or more compound... just a beginner compound and a high end. A real shame, as I really like variety and the challenge that a recurve provides. Same with Shotguns, hope you weren't looking for a large variety here. Seems the devs liked rifles more, and it reflects in the quests, some require super long range shots... which rules out bows and shotties. You get a paltry two reserves.... but they are pretty dang massive. I'd say they are equal to ... the alaskan one from the Hunter Classic in size. Lots of little things to find, and things to do. Shed Hunting, Feed ground spotting, camp finding, dozens of quests, Animal variety is ... fairly small in comparison to the hunter classic. I don't think the game has Grizzly, Wolves, or some of the varieties of Elk and Deer. I also didn't notice ANY waterfowl, or turkey. Although the ambient animals are significantly improved. Lots more birds, rabbits, squirrels ( I think that's what it was.. scared the alcohol right out of me.)So what about the important stuff? The actual hunting? Its superb. When it works. The game seems to have alot more wildlife than the Hunter Classic, so you are in the thick of it pretty much every step. Hit that caller and watch a group of four just wander in. Its probably not realistic, but it gets you into the hunt much quicker. ...now if you don't have any experience with hunting games, you probably will make the mistake of thinking that the .243 you start with is somehow effective at hunting.You would be wrong.The .243 modeled in this game and the Hunter Classic is a pea-shooter, that probably shouldn't be allowed on Deer, I have no experience with .243 in real life, but if you don't make a perfect shot, expect that deer to run for quite a ways. Its a beginner gun, do not expect them to drop with one shot unless you hit the sweet spot behind the front legs kinda near the knee. God help you if you take pot shots at a bear... like I did. 4-6 shots to put down a charging bear is not pretty. You ideally want to upgrade pretty much immediately. Men use bows, as our anscestors did. Real Men use Recurves as god intended, but the developers are clearly not as concerned as I. Point is, the beginner rifle will give you a bad impression if you are new to hunting. Stick with it. ... then get a bow. ;) Nothin like taking that perfect bow shot up close, and watching that buck drop....oh and this might as well be a beta for how buggy it is. I have numerous screenshots in my 3 hours of play of animals getting stuck on vegetation. Really the only bug I've found. If an incredibly annoying one. You spook an animal it will sometimes just fly right into a bush or tree and get stuck. The Hunter Classic had some great bug fixing, so I'm hoping this gets fixed. We shall see. Oh and the tutorial is absolutely terrible. If you are new too hunting, please for the love of god youtube some videos. Animals are smart. You have to be to get them. Calls, Stalking, Tree Stands, and an incredible amount of patience apply here.FINAL VERDICT TOO LONG DIDN'T READ: Lack of weapons. Lack of Reserves. Fantastic game, gorgeous environments, pretty buggy, so unless you LOVE to hunt (Like me.) I would wait for a sale. That being said, I HIGHLY reccomend this game if you are into the hunt.
