												Week 3-4 update:  Looking like devs are making progress but the title still isnt fully polished.The game does run on some older machines but dont expect the world.  If you have crashes, its possible others are experiencing the same.  Devs had made it clear that if you document your bugs clearly & accurately, they will respond in return.   That may not mean your bug is fixed today, but you wont be ignored.I cant yet give this title a thumbs up, because there are still a number of bugs to be worked out.  Im hopeful, but not in a hurried kind of way.  In a couple of months, when its ready, the environments in this game will blow you away.------------------Weekend 1 review -- not reccomended.  Codebase appears incomplete and untested.  This is effectively a pay-to-play beta release, and it is quite broken.I suspect only the most elite high-end systems were tested in the undoubtedly brief QA cycle, and anyone using even remotely old hardware will be out of luck until many bugs are ironed out.For me, I have 2 systems that ran the orginal "theHunter" flawlessly at max settings, and i had hoped that with the same hareware at modest settings i'd be able to evaluate this new release.   But so far its no deal.  with my i7 2600k + gtx 570 the 3d engine will render 1-2 frames before it crashes. Pretty much crashes immediately after the logo screens.  Same exact result for my mobile i7+675gtx.This game obviously has promise and I'll be happy to give it a good reivew once its actually finished.  But for now, they appear to be funding their development cycle with pay to play beta shenanigans.Buyer Beware.

content:
ry 20
theHunter: Call of The Wild has the potential to be the best hunting game out there. It's a great foundation for the perfect hunting game. Unfortunately, that's all the game is at its current state. It's pretty much just a pretty landscape with everything else feeling rushed. When it actually works and you don't encounter one of the many bugs it's a really enjoyable and relaxing experience, but way too often do you find your immersion getting completely ruined by a visual bug or weird AI.Not only that, I feel like it lacks some critical content that you kind of expect from any hunting game. Here are two of the major things I think the game is lacking at the moment, to at least make it a complete hunting game and putting the glitches aside:1. Birds. You can hear them all around you. There are some oddly placed seagulls (or whatever they are) here and there that flies away by the noise you make. But there are no birds to hunt. I was really expecting this to be in the game at release, but knowing where the developers are coming from (the microtransaction hell that is theHunter: Classic) I'm guessing it will be a future DLC. Hard to say if the developers ran out of time or if this is an intentional decision. The shotguns are there to tease you though.2. Any means of transportation. The map is HUGE. It needs some kind of vehicles. And at the pace the character is running it feels even bigger. Sure, you can fast travel between the outposts but first you'll have to find them, usually by going to a lookout point to reveal them on the map and then walk to them to claim them and just hope that you don't accidentally stumble between two static rocks that somehow magically squishes you to death on your way there. Yes, that happened not only once, but three times. I remember playing Deer Hunter 3 back in the days and thought it was cool that you could get around with ATV's, snowmobiles and such. Guess this might be DLC too, concidering there are achievements for traveling "BY FOOT". Feels weird to state that unless they have some other way of travelling planned.Now those are just the features I feel that the game is currently lacking. As an addition to that it's riddled with bugs and some of the most horrible AI/pathfinding I've seen in a game. Which is a good way to completely ruin your immersion that you otherwise get from the stunning visuals. Squirrels gets stuck humping rocks, rabbits run in circles at the speed of light, deer gets stuck against trees and rocks and I've even seen a group of four different animal types running into eachother in a mess that looked like the queue line to the Noah's ark. I try my best to just ignore these derpy animals and move on but you see them way too often to just simply ignore them. I know it must be hard to code AI and especially animal like behaviour but I still don't expect to see these kind of situations in a full release of a hunting game. I've seen a whole pack of wild boars just running into an invisible wall forever. There doesn't seem to be any fall damage in the game, yet somehow you sometimes die if you get stuck between two rocks or try to climb them as I mentioned earlier. I even just flat out died walking on a flat surface at one point. The screen has gone completely blurry as if the field of depth was bugged and also completely red after I died once. These were fixed by just clicking ESC twice to bring up the menu interface (which can be a little bit disorienting at times when it comes to equipment and such) and then close it again. The smartphone is visible in some of the cutscenes, just floating there (sometimes upside down). I've found a hunting stand that was not buildable for whatever reason (surely the developers must have had time to test this once they put it down on the map?) and seen some weirdly placed street signs and poles. There was also this one pile of stones which gives you lore that had the trigger 8 meters underground so it was impossible to activate. I've seen some floating 3D sprites and trees that goes through rocks and some terrain deformities (with stretched textures), but usually you have to look really close for these types of minor glitches. The one visual glitch that occurs the most is the one with parts of the scope disappearing after you take a shot.With all this being said, I really hope the developers listens to the community and addresses these issues. I'm really looking forward to future patches and updates, it can only get better from here and hopefully we'll have our hands on the best hunting experience one can have on a PC. I tried to summarize my experience with the game so far in this review, for the developers and others thinking about buying it, just to let you know what you can expect from it at its current state. I have no complaints about the sounds nor the visuals, but as for now I'll give this game a rating of "Not recommended" until it gets some fixes.

												This really deserves a much higher rating from buyers. If you're even remotely interested in the title buy it. Honestly wouldn't put it past special interest groups to buy the game just to run the rating down. Anyhow I can't figure out what most of the bad review are talking about.Breaking down into pros and cons....Pros- ran 60 to 90 fps without any drops on 1080 custom all ultra- in several hours I unlocked 1/5 of the map and explored maybe 1/20. It would take weeks to explore just one of the two maps completely. It is absolutely huge!- Absolutely gorgeous open world environment. One of the best I've seen in any genre.- Better animal AI than i've seen in any game.- Great rpg skill building. No just running out and shooting rockets on the first day. (ok rockets is hyperbole)-quite realistic tracking after wounding. I made a bad shot on one animal and tracked it for over an hour in the dark. Unfortunately the AI did just what real deer do. It circled back on its own tracks several times till I couldn't tell which way it went in the dark anymore.-don't worry it's easy enough to make a good kill shot with even the .243 you start with. I read one report that made it sound like it happened every time. Not sure what they expect for a starter rifle? 475 h&h maybe? That was only one of many I shot that turned out that way.-No da*n bango music. For anyone that remembers the hunting games where you had the volume turned way up to hear animals and bam, suddenly you forget when you pause it blares frackn banjo music.-I started on the European map. Pleasant voice acting. Very well done.-And the list goes on, but I'll stick to the basicsCons - One time.... One time a deer got stuck....- The store interface just felt a little clunky. Not really bad or game breaking. Very minor update would do it. Really it might just be a matter of preference like ford dash controls vs. volvo.This is one of a very few games i'd say absolutely buy it. It's worth the $30. But hey if you're the next warren buffett or something by all means wait for a sale. (ok i seriously doubt he's a gamer... just sayin)

												This game was released a little early for my liking. It feels like a Beta and there are quite a few bugs. That's the negative. The positive is that the graphics is really great and the gameplay, which may not suit COD fans, is slow and deliberate. This is as close to real life as you can get.Am I glad I bought it? Yes, the bugs will get fixed. DLCs will come out with new reserves and gear. Bear with it. It's still great game with more potential the classic version. It was relatively cheap. Don't curse the Devs, no-one can write perfect code. It was a rush to market, probably for financial reasons. It's just as frustrating as real life when you don't take the time to get a perfect shot. Lots of work ahead, but it's still a great game.

This game makes little attempt to gently induct beginners; it has a poorly designed "tutorial", which says things like "you should see some tracks". You don't. But it leads to nothing. Not even with binocuours 2 metres away.The binocular vison is blurred and it's almost impossible to pan, as you inexplicably have to hold down right click as you look for...nothing. I never really got started with this but then there was nothing to get started on even after an hour - that's an hour of my life I won't get back but thankfully Steam's refund policy means at least I'll get the not inconsiderable price of the game back.

content:
ry 22
I am deeply confused - what's this game supposed to be?Sandbox game? Hunting "Simulation"? Arcade Hunter? Open World Adventure?First of all: Endless, purposeless tranquilityif you enjoy walking up a beautiful virtual hill for 15 minutes without any further purpose but to reach a viewing platform, then this game is totally for you and you should just ignore my review.Second: Oh my god, dem bugs. Others have mentioned it before, but this game is far from being ready for release. For early access the level of bugs and issues would have been acceptable, but still better to call it an open beta.The main problem I have with this, is that ExpansiveWorlds (Avalanche Studios) has a long-standing track record of releasing unfinished content and often never polishing it to perfection even way later. This is true for basically every update theHunter:classic received, but especially for theHunter:Primal - a game that was sold in some kind of beta-state (especially content-wise) and never made it any further.Third: Blimey, dem graphics!The game looks awesome! The vegetation, the scenery, the lighting, the animal models, the animations (well, besides the players hands, what the frog am I doing? Running in the praying mantis karate base pose?) - all looks terrific and stunning. The way you leave a trail of flattened grass behind is just cool. Ok, it looks like you're a Mafiosi that just dragged a concrete-cuffed rival to his favourite dumpster lake, but hey, it's still a cool effect. A shame that the graphics are the only outstanding part of this game. I am more willing to overlook less-than-perfect graphics than flawed game design or mechanics.Last but by no means least - the real review - what is this game meant to be and why did they get it all backwards?So you got theHunter:classic, a massive open-world hunting game with plenty of content and great game mechanics. It just suffers from a meanwhile rather dated graphic engine  (fair enough being already 8 years old) and a microtransaction-based business model that has met plenty of criticism. Yet the cash-cow seems still lactating, as they are still keeping the game alive.So what to do to lead theHunter into the future. Develop a successor and kill your cash flow of the old game? Much better to produce something slightly different that recruits new customers, fascinates your old clientèle and still doesn't stop them from spending on the old one. Much better idea indeed. If you're able to pull it off, that is.So why not make an open world hunting game like the hunter that still has a story line. Red Dead Redemption hunting themed, basically. Nice idea.But then why they got it all backwards? Why does the actual hunting feel like you're mowing down the imbecile cousins of some majestic animals you dreamt of hunting all your life? The actual hunting is no challenge at all, you just need to be in the right place, and the animals will be easy to harvest.The "story line" (in brackets, as I am not sure yet, there's any red line through the story - it might just be random bits) on the other hand is slow as a sloth. A couple of hours in and I haven't even proceeded much in the tutorial story line (it is supposed to be a tutorial, right?). All I did is wander lengthily through a beautiful landscape getting sidetracked by some dull hunting while trying to get to a lodge or view point or camp.I feel a good hunting game with a story line should be exactly the other way around: extensive, to some extend challenging hunting embedded in a faster paced, enthralling story line. That'd be an interesting cross-over game between an emersion-intense hunting game and a hunting-themed arcade/adventure game. This game is exactly the opposite. It got real dull real quick for me, and I am a sucker for a good hunting game.I'll probably wait for a follow-up of theHunter:classic. Or maybe even a similar product by a competent competitor that might be released in a rather finished state - one should be allowed to dream big.

												If you plan on using mouse/keyboard don't get this game in its current state. If you use a controller you'll have a much better experience. Alot of the rage experienced is form mouse/keyboard users and I am one of those users. Luckily I can use my xbox controller on my computer when needed cuz the regular UI hates keyboard mouse. Besides that for gameplay itself its not too bad. there are some bugs, like I've seen animals stuck in terrain but it makes it an easy kill lol. Doesn't happen often but it does happen. A lot of things in the game have no tooltips or any explanation so sure you can tell me that I received no "integrity bonus" for a kill but without telling me what that is what am I supposed to do with that information?  Also avoid using special ironsights, they are auto unequipped anytime you switch out from holding the weapon which is all the time.  Game is slowly getting patches and it still fun, you can loose yourself tracking animals for ages but this game isn't meant to be a FPS where you lock and load, run into the forest and spray lead across a field and spend the next hour harvesting bodies. The is a patience game, a low key game. And it does that well. I can't wait for subsequent patches as it will make this game so much better. My only concern is if they release pay content before fixing the issues and interface.

content:
ry 17
												The Pro's and cons + added comments on those leaving it a negative review.Pro's- The game is spectacularly stunning in places, the foliage itself isnt all that amazing but sheer quantity of it really help to make you feel like your in a primordial forest hunting for your dinner- Getting a killshot from any range is very satisfying - The Kill summary page is well thought out includes almost all information you'd want and is aesthetically really nice- Gunplay seems good, a little difficult as you dont have a shooting range but bullets are free so test away-Animals move and act realistically - Its not easy and that really is a pro, an easy hunting game isnt a hunting game, its an arcade game.- The missions as far as im aware are decent and offer the player plenty of opportunity to learn the basics of the game (even though the mechanics are barely explained)-Multiplayer is good it just needs more depth and fixing so its a bit more fluid getting in and out of games-progression speed and levelling seem balanced and cash flow also doesnt seem to be an issue - Variation of animals is good and the frequency at which you find them is also goodCONS- id like to start this section off by saying that these are menial issues, they arent game breaking, they dont make the game any less playable they are just tweaks that would make the game feel a lot more proper and less thrown together- The main con in this list is the fact you feel like a beta player, its not a case of oo this doesnt work its more a case of ♥♥♥♥ me surely this should be simpler or you'd think they would have explained that a little better- The menu's are poorly designed and feel like placeholders for a far more accurate model that was never made-The tutorial is basically non-existant (i think they expect you to get to level 3) and thats your tutorial over- The quantity of weapons seems rather small but thats easily fixed- The amount of time spent using each weapon to get its upgrade could be reduced as ive killed many things with my rifle and im not even close to the next one- a bit of logic wouldnt go miss in places, like why the next gun i unlock is of lower calibre when im already struggling with big game like bears-Some animals can be a little buggy such as getting caught on terrain or just generally freaking out-Also you give me a shotgun but no birds to shoot? i dont get it? yea i can kill vermin with it but ultimately if you got a shotgun, your killing birds!-The scoreboard and kill history are a bit ♥♥♥♥ as well, they need to completely remake those menu's so the player feels more proud of his kills, a review screen of the kill summary would be a fantastic way to look over previous kills and compare with a friend.- It has crashed on me once but im 14 hours in so it would be hardly fair to complain about crashes.-The level of sound you create is ridiculous it seems like there is only 3 options on how much noise can be made which to mean seems a little silly considering sprinting through a forest should be louder than crawling through bushes very slowly.OVERALL - In the games present state id say but it from cdkeys and save yourself the extra money because you are buying an unfinished product but that being said what you will get for the £20 is a fantastic hunting simulator with insane potential and an active helpful community. The fixes they need to implement are as follows - New (more proffessional) menu system with a more dynamic look at your own personal stats, Redone AI for broken animals such as the bear, simple sound fixes to stop music randomly cutting or animals calls not actually sounding out, they need to implement a whole firing range system that allows you to go and practice at various ranges and with various bullet types (for Free).They need to implement a full guided tutorial that explains everything because i myself had to do a tonne of guesswork. Finally what i will say is buy this game, it may not be finished but in a couple months in i believe the game will have had all issues fixed and more things adeed, its a fantastic game and if you let stupid things like a poor ui stop your from playing it then you should probably just delete steam.

												It just doesn't make sense to have an amazing looking game crash, and have this bad of a menu system. Here is the break down:The game is beautiful graphics wise when you crank it up to Ultra everything but when there are so many bugs it becomes unplayable.There is only one player profile across the board. What you do online is the same as if you play solo mode. (example: I dropped a gun online, it was gone in single player as well. (I create a New Game, it just resets my spawn point of my other game but I have same items skills etc...)The Menus are just a developers nightmear. They never work and 50% of the game you have to move in and out of the menus to change guns, ammo etc... I found myself using my arrow keys and enter key to navigate, and that only works like 70% of the time, but a little better then clicking with a mouse. MENU SYSTEM MUST BE WORKED ON before you buy!There is no leaving a game! Thats right, you can't leave a single player game or a online player game and go directly back to the main menu... You Exit to desktop every time! So if i am playing single player, and my firend gets online and is like join my game... I have to exit the entire game to re-launch it then go to multi player. Multiplayer is a bit buggy, There lag system is broken. Peer to Peer style play. I was just about to bag a nice buck and bam the host left the game, Here is the kicker, The entire game shuts down, Not a crash it ♥♥♥♥ing shuts down?!?! No ♥♥♥♥s where given!Deer and animals get stuck in rocks and ♥♥♥♥ all the time.Single player is way to easy to play, every second there is a sound from an animal or a trailMutliplayer is much more..... its a bit real, animals are harder to find and you need your actual skills to find ♥♥♥♥. I'm not trying to bash this game its just not finnished, its more of a beta then a final game. Don't get me wrong, the game has its ups which would be graphics, I've never seen a deer hunter game look so great in my life. Till the game gets patched with the bugs and suggestions I made above... Its a hard hard pass.

content:
ry 17
												The Pro's and cons + added comments on those leaving it a negative review.Pro's- The game is spectacularly stunning in places, the foliage itself isnt all that amazing but sheer quantity of it really help to make you feel like your in a primordial forest hunting for your dinner- Getting a killshot from any range is very satisfying - The Kill summary page is well thought out includes almost all information you'd want and is aesthetically really nice- Gunplay seems good, a little difficult as you dont have a shooting range but bullets are free so test away-Animals move and act realistically - Its not easy and that really is a pro, an easy hunting game isnt a hunting game, its an arcade game.- The missions as far as im aware are decent and offer the player plenty of opportunity to learn the basics of the game (even though the mechanics are barely explained)-Multiplayer is good it just needs more depth and fixing so its a bit more fluid getting in and out of games-progression speed and levelling seem balanced and cash flow also doesnt seem to be an issue - Variation of animals is good and the frequency at which you find them is also goodCONS- id like to start this section off by saying that these are menial issues, they arent game breaking, they dont make the game any less playable they are just tweaks that would make the game feel a lot more proper and less thrown together- The main con in this list is the fact you feel like a beta player, its not a case of oo this doesnt work its more a case of ♥♥♥♥ me surely this should be simpler or you'd think they would have explained that a little better- The menu's are poorly designed and feel like placeholders for a far more accurate model that was never made-The tutorial is basically non-existant (i think they expect you to get to level 3) and thats your tutorial over- The quantity of weapons seems rather small but thats easily fixed- The amount of time spent using each weapon to get its upgrade could be reduced as ive killed many things with my rifle and im not even close to the next one- a bit of logic wouldnt go miss in places, like why the next gun i unlock is of lower calibre when im already struggling with big game like bears-Some animals can be a little buggy such as getting caught on terrain or just generally freaking out-Also you give me a shotgun but no birds to shoot? i dont get it? yea i can kill vermin with it but ultimately if you got a shotgun, your killing birds!-The scoreboard and kill history are a bit ♥♥♥♥ as well, they need to completely remake those menu's so the player feels more proud of his kills, a review screen of the kill summary would be a fantastic way to look over previous kills and compare with a friend.- It has crashed on me once but im 14 hours in so it would be hardly fair to complain about crashes.-The level of sound you create is ridiculous it seems like there is only 3 options on how much noise can be made which to mean seems a little silly considering sprinting through a forest should be louder than crawling through bushes very slowly.OVERALL - In the games present state id say but it from cdkeys and save yourself the extra money because you are buying an unfinished product but that being said what you will get for the £20 is a fantastic hunting simulator with insane potential and an active helpful community. The fixes they need to implement are as follows - New (more proffessional) menu system with a more dynamic look at your own personal stats, Redone AI for broken animals such as the bear, simple sound fixes to stop music randomly cutting or animals calls not actually sounding out, they need to implement a whole firing range system that allows you to go and practice at various ranges and with various bullet types (for Free).They need to implement a full guided tutorial that explains everything because i myself had to do a tonne of guesswork. Finally what i will say is buy this game, it may not be finished but in a couple months in i believe the game will have had all issues fixed and more things adeed, its a fantastic game and if you let stupid things like a poor ui stop your from playing it then you should probably just delete steam.

content:
30
												Wow, 80 hours already. I think this is also my first Steam review.I enjoy theHunter COTW. At the core it is a hunting simulator, and in that regard it performs somewhat admirably. The landscapes in both playable maps are expansive and beautiful. The game engine really brings out the beauty of these hunting grounds whether it's a clear summer day or moonlit foggy night. Seeing the jagged antlers of the buck you've been intently tracking for what seems like hours shimmer in the sun while it trots within the tall foliage is quite the sight to see. The sun's rays sometimes glow through the trees, creating an ambience that causes you to stop and just take it all in. Through numerous patches that have come after the game's release, the game is in, at least for me, a playable state. As mentioned in many other reviews perhaps these bugs should have been ironed out before release. I won't get into that debate as it seems to be the industry-wide norm. Bugs are minimal now, animal pathing and AI seems to be working more reliabely (though with some major faults, such as herd behavior). I haven't spontaneously combusted by walking between two rocks or two saplings in a long time. Sure, there's still some issues with terrain and how the player/animals interact with it, buggy/misplaced things such as grass hanging in the air, etc. With a map this expansive there are bound to be some issues and animals will eventually get stuck. This is part of the process and is something I can live with. However, due to my aforementioned herd behavior mention, if an animal as part of a herd does manage to bug out on a rock and get stuck, the rest of the animals will circle voilently around it until it dies (or you get trampled). This can lead to some funny/fruitful opportunities but as a hunting simulator it greatly detracts from the immersion. Multiplayer is bare bones minimal. The single-player questing system is absent in the multiplayer version, instead replaced with competitions you can start with other players. These include hitting an animal in the heart first, bagging 3 fallow deer trophies, etc. While it can be a worthy distraction it would have been nice to be able to quest with other players. Especially with those difficult missions (high level photos, gold star ratings, etc.). There remains the issue of connected players to a host server being unable to unlock new landmarks/outposts, etc. I personally never join a server if I play multiplayer as I always want the option, so I host. It explains why there are so many servers with just 1 player in them.My issue is that this developer seems to be following the trend. A console release has been announced recently and with the lack of updates it will only get worse in my opinion. A guise of two separate console and PC development teams is their only defense - just take a look at the patch note comments. The sad truth is that development for the PC version will slow until they get their cash flow from the console release. The game takes a modestly beefy PC to render the graphics at their ultimate potential, and a lot of people don't have the pcmasterrace in them.  If they get a console version that runs at 30 FPS and has full game pad support, a lot of people might hop on that boat. Why wouldn't they release a console version? Lotta money potential. And that seems to be their game - hey, it's a business. TLDR - Console development is a money maker. PC development will likely slow. I enjoy the game, but I can't support the business model as a consumer. I understand it though. Try getting the game when it's on sale. Or, you know... Eat a citrus fruit so you don't get scurvy, matey... 6.5/10

												Though I am not a very good hunter  I still played  the Hunter a fashionable number of hours and enjoyed it very much, even though it had some quirks  and features like micro sales which I find unpalatable but still  it is lush and immensely enjoyable . So when I saw Hunter cotw I thought it would be  a very nice game to buy  and it was at first . I started a new hunter  and learned the rules through the lush wood of Hirshfelden  and grew quite fond of it  then I discovered  problems and bugs such as the animal falling  when hit ,  then starting up  again which prevented me  from  total immersion  animals caught in the textures and keeping running  through, stationarily  but ok  every games has its quirk and I should not complain about it  but still ... This game has a great potential and  is far from reaching it  and Sadly it is embedded in its structure. You have no save... let me explain  You have 2 hunting  territories Leyton lake and Hirshfelden  and you can't  use the same build  of character in the other reservation  worse than that. You'll have to start again in the previous one if you start a new game I was utterly dismayed  when I discovered it . When you  launch a game if you  level up through it  you usually know that your character is going to  be with you even if you start a new one or in the case of The hunter  you don’t lose anything when you start another game. I hope that  I made my point and  would like expensive world to add this particular feature (which is a save mechanism) in order to make the game really enjoyable  and longer lasting. Please consider what I said before buying it It is not a bad game of itself but it is  quite limited Have a good gaming and see you for my next review.

At this point this game is only for real enthusiasts.

												Beatiful game and great fun aswell, but I can't truly recommend yet, until a few things is fixed. First of all there is quite a few annoying bugs, one is that after tracking a wounded moose for a full hour the tracks suddenly disappear. Tracks also tends to disappear altogether, you don't see any tracks at all. Another is hurting yourself for no reason, i lost 75% of my health after touching a tree with my shoulder and diend once after walking in to a firplant.Huge and beatiful landscape, but no vehicles? You can fast travel between camps but the distances are still great and makes the game a truly walk simulator. You can't enter the game menu after you start a game, therefor you have to quit the game and restart it to go to the main menu(Did the developers even try the game?). Multiplayer is fun but one really bad thing is that you cannot unlock any or use points of interest like hunting stands or look out towers at all if you join another players game.Animals stuck in the air is another ugly bug i a game with stunning graphics and enviroment. Resting in a cabin, wich you claim cost money. Sneaking without a controller can't be done unless you tap on W, an even then it's not working right(Once again,dear developers did you actually try the game?). 2 animals have spotted me, 19 smelled me and 1231 have heard me.That's pretty dumb when I believe the game is PC exclusive? Also the game tends to freeze or crash more and more often. Crash or freezes while walking, changing wepons, use lures, pick up lures. I got a constant crash situiation when running west from the Schonfield outpost on Hirschfelden.After they fix many of the bugs I will recommend this game to everyone, and for the love of god give us some kind of transportation and the ability to wait in hunting nests.2017-03-15 Update: Exit to Main MenuOur intention was to bring an “Exit to Main Menu” option to the game with today’s patch but it is unfortunately not ready yet. We are aware that this feature is requested, we just need a bit more time to guarantee that it works flawlessly.Yes, this is still a problem=)

ON TOP OF A 60$ PRICE TAG. This game is worth the money, and with a few patches, it can definitely become a great game. Have patience: not only in the game hunting a bear, but with the development team on patching bugs.

Maybe part of this is because of my inability to play properly due to bugs. effects not working invincible animals etc.Or maybe just because the game has no proper gui and seems half done. If the dev's would read this then I would note that personally I love "The Hunter Classic" and have poored a large chunk of money into it.  So please, bring back ALL the things that made the original great...Things like the huntermate beeing used to track. An intuitive menu that allows for quick and easy access to all equiptment and customizations. All the amazing hunting types. Turkey, ducks, etc. With all that said, I think the reason I am so disappointed is because I feel very pationate about this game. I was hoping for at least what I was able to get from the original. Then after the failure of primal. I purchase a third installment and once again feel let down. Now at the game's current state I would not recommend this at all. Maybe a year down the road they may be able to get this working. Although so far they cant even get primal to save the game. So, yah for me you guys have close to $300 from me. I am am not likely to buy anything else unless I see some serious improvements in the direction of your games.

												With hundreds and hundreds of hours in the original I was a bit skepitcal about this at first. Glad I a took the plunge.It has THE best natural landscapes in any game I have played, as well as the BEST realistic looking lighting I have ever seen in any game ever. Even the way the forest is constructed looks incredibly accurate down to the stages of plant growth and variety. Top marks for that.The animals look and move MUCH more realistically then the original game, Although I have heard reports of terrible pathfinding from the AI and have wittnessed this myself on a few occasions, The most memorable was cornering an entire heard of fallow deer in a nook in a cliff face, all the deer ran in circles I moved in and just sat there shooting at them untill I had about all 8 of them down, it was figurativly shooting fish in a barrel. Only a few times have I seen other pathfinding fails. Mostly they run into rocks and spaz out. This doesn't really bother me as it doesn't happen too often.I have only seen 2 graphical glitches both are minor and not really worth mentioning.The ONLY BUG so far to cause me trouble is with the ammuntition, It takes rifle skill points to unlock different types of ammo, I have unlocked the .270 rifle and saved up and bought it, the ammo was unlocked with the rifle But when I go to buy the ammo it still say locked and won't let me get it... the rifle cant be used without it.I am totally happy with this game and how this series is progressing, PROVIDING this minor and major bugs are fixed reasonably quickly. It also shows my need to upgrade my aging GTX780 as High settings are about as good as I can go and get reasonable framerate.

content:
ry 18
												It just doesn't make sense to have an amazing looking game crash, and have this bad of a menu system. Here is the break down:The game is beautiful graphics wise when you crank it up to Ultra everything but when there are so many bugs it becomes unplayable.There is only one player profile across the board. What you do online is the same as if you play solo mode. (example: I dropped a gun online, it was gone in single player as well. (I create a New Game, it just resets my spawn point of my other game but I have same items skills etc...)The Menus are just a developers nightmear. They never work and 50% of the game you have to move in and out of the menus to change guns, ammo etc... I found myself using my arrow keys and enter key to navigate, and that only works like 70% of the time, but a little better then clicking with a mouse. MENU SYSTEM MUST BE WORKED ON before you buy!There is no leaving a game! Thats right, you can't leave a single player game or a online player game and go directly back to the main menu... You Exit to desktop every time! So if i am playing single player, and my firend gets online and is like join my game... I have to exit the entire game to re-launch it then go to multi player. Multiplayer is a bit buggy, There lag system is broken. Peer to Peer style play. I was just about to bag a nice buck and bam the host left the game, Here is the kicker, The entire game shuts down, Not a crash it ♥♥♥♥ing shuts down?!?! No ♥♥♥♥s where given!Deer and animals get stuck in rocks and ♥♥♥♥ all the time.Single player is way to easy to play, every second there is a sound from an animal or a trailMutliplayer is much more..... its a bit real, animals are harder to find and you need your actual skills to find ♥♥♥♥. I'm not trying to bash this game its just not finnished, its more of a beta then a final game. Don't get me wrong, the game has its ups which would be graphics, I've never seen a deer hunter game look so great in my life. Till the game gets patched with the bugs and suggestions I made above... Its a hard hard pass.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 28
												I never thought I'd see myself falling in love with a hunting game, but theHunter: Call of the Wild has its claws in me and I'm not mad about it. The thrill of the hunt is visceral. You have to rely on sight and sound in a way that few games pull off. Hunting with friends is even better than hunting alone. One person can post up while the other wrangles or lures the prey. It's just dripping with fun if you give yourself the time to get lost in its world. The maps are huge, beautiful, and varied, with plenty of nice set pieces to stumble upon.On the downside, the game is riddled with annoying bugs. Often they require a full restart, which is made worse by the fact that you can't simply back out to the main menu, you MUST quit to the desktop to exit the game. Ironsights will occasionally bug out, activating multiplayer quests will boot your friends from your game, animals will get stuck on geometry, netting you easy kills that cheapen the experience.All of that said, the gameplay is worth dealing with the bugs and it seems the devs are working hard to fix the problems.Pros:Gorgeous VisualsExcellent Sound DesignDamn Fun Gameplay!Cons:Bugs, bugs, bugs

content:
ry 17
												The Pro's and cons + added comments on those leaving it a negative review.Pro's- The game is spectacularly stunning in places, the foliage itself isnt all that amazing but sheer quantity of it really help to make you feel like your in a primordial forest hunting for your dinner- Getting a killshot from any range is very satisfying - The Kill summary page is well thought out includes almost all information you'd want and is aesthetically really nice- Gunplay seems good, a little difficult as you dont have a shooting range but bullets are free so test away-Animals move and act realistically - Its not easy and that really is a pro, an easy hunting game isnt a hunting game, its an arcade game.- The missions as far as im aware are decent and offer the player plenty of opportunity to learn the basics of the game (even though the mechanics are barely explained)-Multiplayer is good it just needs more depth and fixing so its a bit more fluid getting in and out of games-progression speed and levelling seem balanced and cash flow also doesnt seem to be an issue - Variation of animals is good and the frequency at which you find them is also goodCONS- id like to start this section off by saying that these are menial issues, they arent game breaking, they dont make the game any less playable they are just tweaks that would make the game feel a lot more proper and less thrown together- The main con in this list is the fact you feel like a beta player, its not a case of oo this doesnt work its more a case of ♥♥♥♥ me surely this should be simpler or you'd think they would have explained that a little better- The menu's are poorly designed and feel like placeholders for a far more accurate model that was never made-The tutorial is basically non-existant (i think they expect you to get to level 3) and thats your tutorial over- The quantity of weapons seems rather small but thats easily fixed- The amount of time spent using each weapon to get its upgrade could be reduced as ive killed many things with my rifle and im not even close to the next one- a bit of logic wouldnt go miss in places, like why the next gun i unlock is of lower calibre when im already struggling with big game like bears-Some animals can be a little buggy such as getting caught on terrain or just generally freaking out-Also you give me a shotgun but no birds to shoot? i dont get it? yea i can kill vermin with it but ultimately if you got a shotgun, your killing birds!-The scoreboard and kill history are a bit ♥♥♥♥ as well, they need to completely remake those menu's so the player feels more proud of his kills, a review screen of the kill summary would be a fantastic way to look over previous kills and compare with a friend.- It has crashed on me once but im 14 hours in so it would be hardly fair to complain about crashes.-The level of sound you create is ridiculous it seems like there is only 3 options on how much noise can be made which to mean seems a little silly considering sprinting through a forest should be louder than crawling through bushes very slowly.OVERALL - In the games present state id say but it from cdkeys and save yourself the extra money because you are buying an unfinished product but that being said what you will get for the £20 is a fantastic hunting simulator with insane potential and an active helpful community. The fixes they need to implement are as follows - New (more proffessional) menu system with a more dynamic look at your own personal stats, Redone AI for broken animals such as the bear, simple sound fixes to stop music randomly cutting or animals calls not actually sounding out, they need to implement a whole firing range system that allows you to go and practice at various ranges and with various bullet types (for Free).They need to implement a full guided tutorial that explains everything because i myself had to do a tonne of guesswork. Finally what i will say is buy this game, it may not be finished but in a couple months in i believe the game will have had all issues fixed and more things adeed, its a fantastic game and if you let stupid things like a poor ui stop your from playing it then you should probably just delete steam.

												This is an exceptional hunting experience. The graphics in this game are truly breathtaking and the animations of the animals is detailed. This comes at the cost of performance but it is well worth upgrading your machine just to experience this game on ultra the vistas are jaw dropping.Theres a couple of clipping issues with some rare holes in the mesh where you can see under the terrain at the water plane. I ran into choppy audio but I've got a feeling this is my processor stuggling to keep up. The game seems to be taking up above 90 percent of my processors resources and my graphics card only has 2 gig of vram. To enjoy ultra textures you will need at least a 4gig card but it's well worth it. One thing i did notice though is when i shone my torch at the animal it didn't spook. I don't know if this happens maybe the animal freezes up in shock from the light. Maybe have it realistically reacting to torchlight is a feature you can add.Recommended!

												Though I am not a very good hunter  I still played  the Hunter a fashionable number of hours and enjoyed it very much, even though it had some quirks  and features like micro sales which I find unpalatable but still  it is lush and immensely enjoyable . So when I saw Hunter cotw I thought it would be  a very nice game to buy  and it was at first . I started a new hunter  and learned the rules through the lush wood of Hirshfelden  and grew quite fond of it  then I discovered  problems and bugs such as the animal falling  when hit ,  then starting up  again which prevented me  from  total immersion  animals caught in the textures and keeping running  through, stationarily  but ok  every games has its quirk and I should not complain about it  but still ... This game has a great potential and  is far from reaching it  and Sadly it is embedded in its structure. You have no save... let me explain  You have 2 hunting  territories Leyton lake and Hirshfelden  and you can't  use the same build  of character in the other reservation  worse than that. You'll have to start again in the previous one if you start a new game I was utterly dismayed  when I discovered it . When you  launch a game if you  level up through it  you usually know that your character is going to  be with you even if you start a new one or in the case of The hunter  you don’t lose anything when you start another game. I hope that  I made my point and  would like expensive world to add this particular feature (which is a save mechanism) in order to make the game really enjoyable  and longer lasting. Please consider what I said before buying it It is not a bad game of itself but it is  quite limited Have a good gaming and see you for my next review.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 28
												I never thought I'd see myself falling in love with a hunting game, but theHunter: Call of the Wild has its claws in me and I'm not mad about it. The thrill of the hunt is visceral. You have to rely on sight and sound in a way that few games pull off. Hunting with friends is even better than hunting alone. One person can post up while the other wrangles or lures the prey. It's just dripping with fun if you give yourself the time to get lost in its world. The maps are huge, beautiful, and varied, with plenty of nice set pieces to stumble upon.On the downside, the game is riddled with annoying bugs. Often they require a full restart, which is made worse by the fact that you can't simply back out to the main menu, you MUST quit to the desktop to exit the game. Ironsights will occasionally bug out, activating multiplayer quests will boot your friends from your game, animals will get stuck on geometry, netting you easy kills that cheapen the experience.All of that said, the gameplay is worth dealing with the bugs and it seems the devs are working hard to fix the problems.Pros:Gorgeous VisualsExcellent Sound DesignDamn Fun Gameplay!Cons:Bugs, bugs, bugs

												Dear Devs and All,  this is an engaging game.  The landscape, weather and environment are really very nice indeed.  It is however currently let down by several issues which affect gameplay and overall enjoyment which SHOULD NOT be in this post beta release.  Namely: you change the music settings to zero and yet it still plays loud music(!)  The interface is very ropey, more often than not clicking or pressing ''escape' on the keyboard to try and leave the interface (settings for example) does nothing >.< grrr.  Deer, indeed herds of deer, caught up running around in circles or up against the landscape ad infinitum.  Walking/squatting or kitten crawling seems to make little change to noise or animals awareness of you.  Gear is so expensive. But lastly the most annoying thing is, it takes ages, absolutely ages to get from one area to another... As has already been suggested - a tent or 'camp for the night' feature would make this all much more tolerable.Cheers!

												Absolutely loving this game! I am not having any of the issues others have reported. I'm not having any backpack issues, store/storage issues, or not being able to escape out of menu issues. I do however have the issue of not being able to run the game in SLI yet. But that's not a deal breaker as it runs fine for me off of one GPU. Not 144hz fine but it's running at a steady 60fps fine, which isn't bad with G-sync turned on.As far as people complaining about not being able to escape from a menu, just click the map tab or any other tab to get out of settings and then hit Escape. Easy Peezy. Graphics are fantastic and the sound is pretty damn good as well. This game runs very nicely for the amount of detail in it. I am quite impressed. After reading so many negative reviews about bugs and such I was very skeptical going into this game. Well, maybe I'm just lucky. I have no idea, but I have been having a blast. No stuck animals yet either. Hell I tracked a bleading deer for about an hour and a half earlier. Would have been nice if it would have gotten stuck :)I would recommend this game for it's current price of $30. Oh and don't let my hours in game fool you. I have been playing quite a bit on my shared account as well.No graphical glitches on my end either.System specs for reference:i7-5820k @4.7Ghz2x Titan X SLI (Maxwell), can only use one card at the momentResolution: 2560x1440 @144hz32Gb 2400mhz RAMAMD systems may be the ones with most of the problems? I have no idea as I don't see specs in most of these reviews and I haven't tried playing this on one of my AMD GPU builds yet.

												10/10 would track a black bear for an hour and lose it again This game is great. First off, you need certain traits to be able to properly enjoy this game, and most of all, you need certain specs to be able to run the game to its full capacity  to even be able to properly enjoy it the way it is supposed to be enjoyed/played. Right now, there are a couple glitches I've encountered within the game, but nothing worth writing a bad review over or even mentioning. This game is visually, one of the most beautiful games that I've ever played. The sounds of the forest, the rain, the sounds of the rifle, everything visually and auditory is breathtakingly beautiful.You can go an hour following tracks, and end up with nothing or a missed shot.. or you can see two black bears and two coyotes within an hour. It's hit and miss and makes for a great thrill when you finally find the prey you've been tracking. Overall, this is a great game with very minor glitches that don't change the game in the slightest. I definitely recommend buying this if you have the patience to endure it. It's totally worth it.

ry 18
												It just doesn't make sense to have an amazing looking game crash, and have this bad of a menu system. Here is the break down:The game is beautiful graphics wise when you crank it up to Ultra everything but when there are so many bugs it becomes unplayable.There is only one player profile across the board. What you do online is the same as if you play solo mode. (example: I dropped a gun online, it was gone in single player as well. (I create a New Game, it just resets my spawn point of my other game but I have same items skills etc...)The Menus are just a developers nightmear. They never work and 50% of the game you have to move in and out of the menus to change guns, ammo etc... I found myself using my arrow keys and enter key to navigate, and that only works like 70% of the time, but a little better then clicking with a mouse. MENU SYSTEM MUST BE WORKED ON before you buy!There is no leaving a game! Thats right, you can't leave a single player game or a online player game and go directly back to the main menu... You Exit to desktop every time! So if i am playing single player, and my firend gets online and is like join my game... I have to exit the entire game to re-launch it then go to multi player. Multiplayer is a bit buggy, There lag system is broken. Peer to Peer style play. I was just about to bag a nice buck and bam the host left the game, Here is the kicker, The entire game shuts down, Not a crash it ♥♥♥♥ing shuts down?!?! No ♥♥♥♥s where given!Deer and animals get stuck in rocks and ♥♥♥♥ all the time.Single player is way to easy to play, every second there is a sound from an animal or a trailMutliplayer is much more..... its a bit real, animals are harder to find and you need your actual skills to find ♥♥♥♥. I'm not trying to bash this game its just not finnished, its more of a beta then a final game. Don't get me wrong, the game has its ups which would be graphics, I've never seen a deer hunter game look so great in my life. Till the game gets patched with the bugs and suggestions I made above... Its a hard hard pass.

												With hundreds and hundreds of hours in the original I was a bit skepitcal about this at first. Glad I a took the plunge.It has THE best natural landscapes in any game I have played, as well as the BEST realistic looking lighting I have ever seen in any game ever. Even the way the forest is constructed looks incredibly accurate down to the stages of plant growth and variety. Top marks for that.The animals look and move MUCH more realistically then the original game, Although I have heard reports of terrible pathfinding from the AI and have wittnessed this myself on a few occasions, The most memorable was cornering an entire heard of fallow deer in a nook in a cliff face, all the deer ran in circles I moved in and just sat there shooting at them untill I had about all 8 of them down, it was figurativly shooting fish in a barrel. Only a few times have I seen other pathfinding fails. Mostly they run into rocks and spaz out. This doesn't really bother me as it doesn't happen too often.I have only seen 2 graphical glitches both are minor and not really worth mentioning.The ONLY BUG so far to cause me trouble is with the ammuntition, It takes rifle skill points to unlock different types of ammo, I have unlocked the .270 rifle and saved up and bought it, the ammo was unlocked with the rifle But when I go to buy the ammo it still say locked and won't let me get it... the rifle cant be used without it.I am totally happy with this game and how this series is progressing, PROVIDING this minor and major bugs are fixed reasonably quickly. It also shows my need to upgrade my aging GTX780 as High settings are about as good as I can go and get reasonable framerate.

												I am truly disappointed in this game so far. Looks so amazing yet the amount of bugs tells me they rushed to release. Not to mention the horrible gui. For gods sake get rid of that annoying beep while navigating the menu. Besides the game not being playable for me (buggy, not a system spec problem). While as visually appealing as it is. They have missed the mark. The entire experience is dulled by the Gui, and lack of customization. You start the game with no idea what to do. For me I was unable to see tracks at all until I installed on my other pc and then I was finally able to see the tracks glow. Then that quit working on that pc.  Sigh's after about 5hrs of gameplay I still have not found out how to buy weapons or change camo. Maybe part of this is because of my inability to play properly due to bugs. effects not working invincible animals etc.Or maybe just because the game has no proper gui and seems half done. If the dev's would read this then I would note that personally I love "The Hunter Classic" and have poored a large chunk of money into it.  So please, bring back ALL the things that made the original great...Things like the huntermate beeing used to track. An intuitive menu that allows for quick and easy access to all equiptment and customizations. All the amazing hunting types. Turkey, ducks, etc. With all that said, I think the reason I am so disappointed is because I feel very pationate about this game. I was hoping for at least what I was able to get from the original. Then after the failure of primal. I purchase a third installment and once again feel let down. Now at the game's current state I would not recommend this at all. Maybe a year down the road they may be able to get this working. Although so far they cant even get primal to save the game. So, yah for me you guys have close to $300 from me. I am am not likely to buy anything else unless I see some serious improvements in the direction of your games.

												This game is absolutely gorgeous. Everything about this game excited me from the first time I saw it. Coming from the original theHunter, this is a breath of fresh air. No subscriptions. No penalties for wrong caliber. This is really an open-world hunting experience that can be sort of mission based if you choose, or not. Pros: Graphics, Animals, Realism, Map, "Noccys" (Binoculars).Cons:Bugs, Glitchy Animal AI, No "Back to Main Menu" Option.I feel that at this price point, this game is a steal. 30$ may seem steep, but AAA titles like Madden and FIFA release the same ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game every year, riddled with microransactions and ways for them to make money... ON TOP OF A 60$ PRICE TAG. This game is worth the money, and with a few patches, it can definitely become a great game. Have patience: not only in the game hunting a bear, but with the development team on patching bugs.

Bigger trophy more xp,money and rifle score as well and don't forget the distance longer shoot mor point. Finaly yes worthy to buy good job devs keep up the bug fixings i love the game.

content:
ry 20
												Alright the game has been out for just under a week and i already have >20 hours time played.  This is a great follow up theHunter original - i would say if you enjoyed that game and your computer can handle the new engine then you will also enjoy Call of the Wild.  The environment and graphics are incredible.  The sound stage is great.  The improvments to draw distance were so needed and really breathe new life into Call of the Wild (draw distance was why i stopped playing the original game).  Overall there are a few glitchy things but i think the devs still deserve credit for a solid release.  Reading through some of the other reviews and discussions i think some people are definitely blowing the issues out of proportion.  I can recall a number of AAA titles with a $60 price tag in the last year that have had far far far worse bugs (i.e. AAA titles with actual game breaking bugs: falling through maps, blue screen of death, etc.) and i have not experienced anything even remotely close to that magnitude with theHunter.  There are a few hiccups in the menus (both start and in game).  The animal UI is suitable for now but also has some opportunities around movement patterns, behavior on steep terrain, and fleeing.Sure, there are a couple of things that need to be ironed out but the potential is CLEARLY here.  I have already gotten more than $30 of enjoyment out of the game over the first weekend.  I'd love to see some refinement to the bow hunting in the future, some additional stat tracking, and the inclusion of ATVs for getting around faster than walking.

Also be careful with alot of these negative reviews. 												After playing theHunter classic for over 300 hours I was excited to try CotW. Let me begin by saying that the current state of the game is that it feels unfinished. A few more weeks of testing and bug fixing was not a bad idea.So expect things  like ui not working, game crashing, sounds sometimes not playing when they should. Game mechanics not working,animals getting stuck...that sort of thing.However, I feel this game has great potential to be a very immersive and beautiful (the graphics look fantastic) hunting simulator. The sim aspects are familiar If you have played theHunter classic ,you will know how it works. It's basically the same,stay downwind, dont make too much noise and hear the animal call to llocate it.I had some good fun hunting but the game definitly needs more work and lets hope the devs are up to it. If they manage to sort out the bugs this could be a great game

												I'm an avid player of theHunter and was excited for this release, but I have to warn everyone to NOT BUY THIS! In its current state it's completely broken. There are dozens of glaring bugs which cause crashes, inability to join friends in multiplayer, animals glitching into terrain, the server browser not working correctly and many more issues.On top of that there are issues which are just terrible design and should be patched out immediately. There is no option of exiting a single player/multiplayer game to the main menu, you have to quit to desktop and reboot the game. The Lake District map is literally crawling with deer, it's like a shooting range. Animals don't appear to react to gunfire unless they've been hit with a bullet, you can shoot 6 deer without the others in the herd caring.Wait and see if they fix the game with patches before considering purchasing this.

												This is a working progress review. My first time playing a hunter game as my old potato laptop couldnt run the old hunter game. I have to say this game is really good so far. Ive only really hunted deer and foxes so far mind you.Pros: 1). The Graphics are amazing in this game from the scenary to the wildlife.2). The reserves are brilliantly done and are huge in scale.3). Sounds are brilliant also, from the natural ambience to the gun sounds. Everything that makes a noise in this game sounds like it should.4). The wildlife that are in the game look amazing (although thier eyes look wierd up close).5). Really nice weapon models.6). Single player and multiplayer/co-op.Cons:1). AI sometimes bugs out and gets stuck on things. And some of the animations aren't very fluid ect, when the bear stands up, it sort of telleports upright.2). After you fire your weapon sometimes your rifles scope bugs out. (not sure how to explain it).3). There's a few animals in the game you can kill but get nothing for, like rabbits and squirils.4). No trophy system (Yet).5). No leaderboards.6). Needs real bows not just crappy compound ones. And more rifles of different calibers.7). Should be more customization options for you character to make your clothing unique.8). Tons of bugs ranging from your guns going invisible and not being able to look down you scope without it being at a angle so you can see anything through it, to your game crashing alot (mines only started crashing after 15 hours playtime mind you).9). Not being able to collect your own trophies in a multiplayer session sometimes, although if you have friends you play with they can do it for you.So far ill give this a 7/10 and hope they add more animals to hunt and stuff to hunt with and mybe the option to build a hunting station where ever we want not just pre determined places. Once they fix the crashes at least i will have no problem giving it a higher score as i can live with bugs after playing arma 3 for so long.
